0.title: Husband found guilty of abetting suicide in Kerala student's dowry death case
0.article_body: A Kerala court on Monday convicted S Kiran Kumar, the husband of Ayurveda medical student Vismaya V Nair who died by suicide in her marital home in June last year, for dowry death and abetting her suicide. Officials said the court is expected to pronounce the sentence on Tuesday after hearing arguments on behalf of the prosecution and the convict.

1.title: Varanasi court completes hearing on Gyanvapi Mosque case, reserves decision
1.article_body: A Varanasi court has completed hearing on a civil suit on the Gyanvapi mosque-Kashi Viswanath temple complex dispute and reserved its decision until May 24. The Supreme Court on Friday ordered the transfer of the pending proceedings in the case to the District Judge in Varanasi. It had said that the case should be handled by a senior judicial official.

2.title: Musk's SpaceX looking to raise funds at a valuation of $127 billion: Report
2.article_body: Elon Musk's SpaceX is looking to raise up to $1.725 billion in new capital, CNBC reported citing a company-wide email. The spacecraft manufacturing company will raise new funds at a price of $70 per share, sending its valuation to $127 billion, CNBC added. With this, the 20-year-old company is poised to become the most valuable startup in the US.

3.title: Restaurant fined for forcing customer to pay ₹165 service charge in Hyderabad
3.article_body: A consumer forum in Hyderabad has directed a restaurant, which charged a customer ₹164.95 as service charge last year, to pay a fine of ₹3,000 and refund the service charge to the customer. The customer said that he was forced to pay the service charge even after he showed the restaurant manager information about service charge guidelines.

4.title: Wept loudly when I learnt my film was releasing on OTT, not in theatres: Aditi
4.article_body: Aditi Rao Hydari, speaking about her Malayalam movie 'Sufiyum Sujatayum', said it was a very special film, adding that she "wept loudly" when she learnt that it was going to release on OTT instead of theatres. "Makers took my view...but I realised...I can't put...producers under stress," she said. Aditi added when she "saw...magic of OTT", she realised medium isn't important.

5.title: I never aspired for my movies to be at a film festival: Imtiaz Ali
5.article_body: Filmmaker Imtiaz Ali has stated that he has never aspired for any of his movies to be at a film festival, adding he doesn't have much knowledge about the festivals either. "I know...people that make movies that would go to a film festival...I don't think like that. I want to make movies that people would want to watch," Imtiaz added.

6.title: Search underway to locate Delhi engineer lost in forest area in Pune
6.article_body: An extensive search and rescue operation is underway for a 24-year-old mechanical engineer from Delhi who lost his way in the forest area during a trek near Lonavala in Pune. He had called his brother and some friends and informed them that he had lost his way. Later, his phone became unreachable and he has been untraceable.

7.title: Aditi Ashok calls out Air France over missing golf bag, says 'Need it immediately'
7.article_body: Indian golfer Aditi Ashok took to Twitter to call out Air France over her missing golf bag. She wrote, "Need your immediate response...My golf bag didn't make it on the flight from CDG. I've already shared...bag tag details on DM." She added, "I need it immediately as I've a tournament. Respond immediately and make sure my bag arrives by tomorrow."

8.title: CSK need player like Raina, he was a proven player in IPL: Shastri
8.article_body: Ex-India player Ravi Shastri said batter Suresh Raina was a proven player in the IPL and added Chennai Super Kings need a player like him in the team. "While Ambati Rayudu and Robin Uthappa will still play, it will make a lot of difference if they get some cushion," Shastri stated. CSK finished ninth on the IPL 2022 points table.

9.title: Haryana local body polls to be held on June 19
9.article_body: The Haryana State Election Commissioner Dhanpat Singh has announced that the elections for the 46 local bodies of Haryana will be held on June 19. Voters can cast their votes between 7 am to 6 pm while the counting of votes will take place on June 22. Notably, the process of nomination will continue from May 30 to June 4.

10.title: Govt likely to stick to fiscal deficit target: RBI Governor
10.article_body: There may not necessarily be a need for the government to increase borrowing just yet and the Centre is likely to stick to its fiscal deficit target as specified in Budget 2022, said RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das. "There's no...co-relation between increase in government expenditure...and the need for additional borrowing. These are...figures which keep moving throughout the year," Das added.

11.title: A lot of people had given up on me: Dinesh Karthik on Team India comeback
11.article_body: On being recalled to Team India T20I squad, Dinesh Karthik said that it is "probably" his most special comeback as a lot of people had given up on him. "I am in many ways indebted to RCB for picking me and giving me that role," he added. Karthik has been included in India's 18-member squad for South Africa series.

12.title: Group of millionaires protests, says 'tax us now' amid WEF at Davos
12.article_body: Amid the World Economic Forum (WEF), a group of millionaires protested in Davos and demanded that governments tax the wealthy to tackle the cost of living crises across the globe. "The only credible outcome from this conference (WEF) is to tax the richest and tax us now," said Phil White of 'Patriotic Millionaires'.

13.title: India's future is bright: SoftBank CEO Son after meeting PM Modi in Tokyo
13.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Japanese conglomerate SoftBank's billionaire Founder and CEO Masayoshi Son in Tokyo on Monday. "India is growing quickly. There are new startups and unicorns every day. I think India's future is bright," Son said. PM Modi commended SoftBank's role in India's startup sector and discussed opportunities in research, technology and ways to boost investment linkages.

14.title: Heatwave conditions in Delhi to remain subdued till May 29-30: IMD
14.article_body: Heatwave conditions in Delhi are likely to remain suppressed till around May 29 or 30, on account of active western disturbance that brought rainfall to northwest India on Monday, IMD scientist RK Jenamani said. "The peak of today's thunderstorm and rainfall activity was seen this morning, but cloudy conditions are likely to persist till evening or tomorrow morning," he added.

15.title: Man arrested for molesting girls, aged 9 & 17, on footpath in Pune
15.article_body: A 31-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly inappropriately touched two girls, who are sisters, while they were walking on a footpath outside a housing society in Pune's Sahakar Nagar. A sub-inspector said that the accused was a resident of the same area. The girls' mother had filed a case against the man and accused him of molesting her daughters.

16.title: Crypto has no underlying value, Govt more or less in sync with this: RBI Guv
16.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das while speaking about cryptocurrencies said it is "something whose underlying (value) is nothing". He said that statements coming from the Centre are "more or less in sync" with this. The Governor added, "There are big questions on how to regulate it. Our position remains...clear, it will...undermine the monetary, financial and macroeconomic stability of India."

17.title: How much prize money did the top 6 Premier League clubs win after 2021/22 season?
17.article_body: Manchester City, who won their second consecutive Premier League title, won prize money of £44 million. Second-placed Liverpool, who finished with just one point behind Manchester City, won £41.8 million. Meanwhile, third-placed Chelsea received prize money of £39.6 million. They were followed by Tottenham (£37.4 million), Arsenal (£35.2 million) and Manchester United (£33 million).

18.title: Belgium becomes first country to introduce compulsory monkeypox quarantine
18.article_body: Belgium has become the first country to introduce a compulsory 21-day monkeypox quarantine after four cases were confirmed in the country. Around 14 countries have confirmed outbreaks of the viral disease. The infections in Belgium, the first of which was recorded on Friday, are all linked to a festival in the port city of Antwerp.

19.title: 13 countries to join new Asia-Pacific trade framework, announces Biden; India included
19.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Monday announced in Japan that 13 countries have joined a new, US-led Asia-Pacific trade initiative, the Indo-Pacific Economic Framework for Prosperity or the IPEF. Alongside the US, the other countries included in the framework are India, Australia, Brunei, Indonesia, Japan, the Republic of Korea, Malaysia, New Zealand, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand and Vietnam.

20.title: Akhilesh Yadav has been too used to air-conditioned rooms: OP Rajbhar
20.article_body: SBSP National President Om Prakash Rajbhar said his ally SP chief Akhilesh Yadav has been "too used to air-conditioned rooms". "His party leaders complain that he does not meet anyone. He should venture out more often to constituencies," Rajbhar said. "Akhilesh's leaders have told me that I should advise him so that he meets people," Rajbhar stated.

21.title: Encourages separatists: Himanta Sarma on Rahul's 'Union of States' remark
21.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma has criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's "Union of States" remark made in London last week. "He (Rahul) is indirectly encouraging separatist elements by describing India as a federation of states," CM Sarma said. "He is promoting separatist sentiments...There is no difference between his language and that of militant outfit ULFA," he added.

22.title: Gurugram issues work-from-home advisory for private offices due to heavy rain
22.article_body: After Chandigarh weather department’s forecast of rainfall and thunderstorm today, the Gurugram administration has issued a work-from-home advisory for corporate offices. “Private institutions/corporate offices are advised to guide their employees to work from home for today...so that traffic congestion on road can be avoided and repair renovation work...can be done smoothly,” the advisory read.

23.title: 35-year-old businessman shot in face while resisting robbery attempt in Delhi
23.article_body: A 35-year-old businessman was shot in his face while resisting an attempt to robbery in Delhi's Hari Nagar area on Sunday. However, the victim, identified as Pradeep Singh Sandhu, is now stable, police said. Sandhu was walking near the Hari Nagar Clock Tower when four unidentified men allegedly tried to snatch his bracelet and gold chain, police added.

24.title: Sidhu taken to hospital for check-up 3 days after being lodged in jail
24.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu was taken to Rajindra Hospital in Patiala for a medical check-up on Monday, three days after he was lodged in jail. Earlier on May 21, Sidhu's lawyer had claimed that the former Punjab Congress chief was refusing prison food as he's allergic to wheat. Sidhu is undergoing one-year imprisonment in the 1988 road rage case.

25.title: Expectation of a rate hike is a no-brainer: RBI Guv on upcoming repo rate hikes
25.article_body: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das in an interview revealed that the central bank wants to increase repo rates in the next few meetings and that the "expectation of a rate hike is a no-brainer". He said, "By how much, I won't be able to tell now but to say that (it will be hiked) to 5.15% now will not be accurate."

26.title: Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air shares pics of its 1st aircraft, says 'Can't keep calm!'
26.article_body: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air on Monday tweeted pictures of its first aircraft. Sharing a picture of the aircraft, it wrote, "Can't keep calm! Say hi to our QP-pie!" While sharing another picture it wrote, "Coming soon to your sky". Akasa Air, which plans to start flight operations in July, had said that its airline code will be 'QP'.

27.title: 22-yr-old techie dies at illegal rave party in Chennai
27.article_body: A 22-year-old IT professional, identified as S Praveen, died at an illegal rave party held at a mall in Chennai's Anna Nagar area. The reason for the deceased's death is suspected to be consumption of excess alcohol, police said. Also, the rave party was being held without the mandatory licence, police added. Notably, three people have been arrested.

28.title: Got message saying 'Salman loved it': Stylist on making Race 3 jacket in 8 hrs
28.article_body: Designer Jishad Shamsudeen said that he made the jacket that actor Salman Khan wore in a 'Race 3' song in eight hours. He further said that he did not know it was being made for Salman Khan and got to know when he delivered the completed jacket. "Following day...I received a message saying, 'Salman loved the jacket'," Jishad added.

29.title: Umran wins award for fastest delivery in all of SRH's IPL 2022 matches, earns ₹14 lakh
29.article_body: SRH fast bowler Umran Malik won the 'Fastest Delivery of the Match' award in each of SRH's 14 matches in IPL 2022. The 22-year-old won a total cash prize of ₹14 lakh. His fastest delivery in IPL 2022 had come against DC, when he clocked 157 kmph. He took 22 wickets in the tournament.

30.title: 900 workers recreated Ajmer & Kannauj, real marble was used: Prithviraj maker
30.article_body: Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi, director of Akshay Kumar starrer 'Prithviraj', has revealed that producer Aditya Chopra recreated 12th century Delhi, Ajmer and Kannauj from scratch. "Real marble was used...900 workers toiled hard for about eight months to build this gigantic set that was a marvel for our eyes," he added. Aditya reportedly spent ₹25 crore to recreate Delhi, Ajmer and Kannauj.

31.title: SL's Kusal Mendis walks off the field holding his chest during B'desh Test, hospitalised
31.article_body: Sri Lanka's Kusal Mendis was taken off the field after he suffered chest pain while fielding in the slip cordon during the opening day of the second Test against Bangladesh in Dhaka. Kusal has been hospitalised as part of a precautionary check-up. As per a doctor, Kusal was suffering from dehydration leading into the match.

32.title: Chris Pratt, Katherine announce birth of second daughter, name her Eloise
32.article_body: Actor Chris Pratt and Katherine Schwarzenegger have welcomed their second child, a baby girl. Pratt took to his social media handles to share the news, writing, "We're so excited to announce the birth of our second daughter, Eloise Christina Schwarzenegger Pratt. Mama and baby are doing well." The couple welcomed their first daughter, Lyla Maria Schwarzenegger Pratt, in August 2020.

33.title: IMD lists expected impact of thunderstorm in Delhi & nearby areas, suggests action
33.article_body: The India Meteorological Department took to Twitter to share list of expected impact due to thunderstorm, duststorm, lightning and rainfall in Delhi and its surrounding areas. In its tweet, IMD said that damage to vulnerable structures, kutcha houses/walls, traffic disruption and reduction in visibility are expected. IMD also suggested people to stay indoors and get out of water bodies.

34.title: Landlord rapes 20-yr-old woman at gunpoint in Bengaluru; arrested
34.article_body: A 46-year-old landlord was arrested on Sunday for allegedly raping his 20-year-old female tenant at gunpoint in Bengaluru. The incident had occurred in April when the accused barged into the woman's house and threatened her with his gun, police said. The police added that according to the complaint, the accused used to harass the woman over friends visiting her house.

35.title: US' Indo-Pacific strategy bound to fail: China ahead of Quad summit
35.article_body: Ahead of the Quad summit in Japan, Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi on Sunday said that the US-led Indo-Pacific strategy is bound to "fail". He claimed that the strategy aims to "contain China" and make Asia-Pacific countries "pawns" for the US. "Facts will prove that the...[strategy is to] create division, incite confrontation and undermine peace," he also claimed.

36.title: Video shows man falling from 30 feet while climbing Karnataka dam; case filed
36.article_body: A young man has been hospitalised in Bengaluru after he fell to the ground from a height of 30 feet while trying to scale the wall of Srinivasa Sagara dam in Karnataka's Chikkaballapur. A video showed him climbing the wall of the dam, however, after scaling the wall halfway, he lost balance and fell. Police registered a case against him.

37.title: Girl reported to be kidnapped on train found with lover at Vadodara station
37.article_body: Police found a girl with her lover at the Vadodara railway station soon after they received information that the girl, travelling on the Avantika Express train, had been "kidnapped". "Following a probe, it was found that the girl was with a [man]...During interrogation, it was revealed that both were in love but the [man] was married," a police official said.

38.title: Gurugram issues work-from-home advisory for private offices due to heavy rain
38.article_body: After Chandigarh weather department’s forecast of rainfall and thunderstorm today, the Gurugram administration has issued a work-from-home advisory for corporate offices. “Private institutions/corporate offices are advised to guide their employees to work from home for today...so that traffic congestion on road can be avoided and repair renovation work...can be done smoothly,” the advisory read.

39.title: Oil prices at $110/barrel pose bigger threat than inflation: Hardeep Singh Puri
39.article_body: Union Petroleum Minister Hardeep Singh Puri has said that oil prices staying at $110/barrel could pose bigger threats than inflation to the global economy. Speaking at Davos, the minister said, "If oil prices remain at $110/barrel you are not just talking about inflation, then you're talking about bigger threats. You know, that's where the R (recession) word comes in."

40.title: Which players took the most wickets for their teams in league stage of IPL 2022?
40.article_body: RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal finished as the highest wicket-taker in league stage of IPL 2022 with 26 wickets. T20 World Cup 2021's highest wicket-taker Wanindu Hasaranga took 24 wickets for RCB. PBKS' Kagiso Rabada was the highest wicket-taker among pacers in league stage with 23 wickets. SRH fast bowler Umran Malik took most wickets for his team with 22 scalps.

41.title: Who top-scored for their teams in league stage of IPL 2022?
41.article_body: RR opener Jos Buttler ended the IPL 2022 league stage as the highest run-getter, with 629 runs. LSG captain KL Rahul top-scored for his franchise with 537 runs, while Shikhar Dhawan top-scored for PBKS with 460 runs. RCB captain Faf du Plessis top-scored for his team with 443 runs. Uncapped all-rounder Abhishek Sharma top-scored for SRH with 426 runs.

42.title: World's 10 richest men own more wealth than bottom 40% of humanity: Oxfam
42.article_body: The world’s ten richest men own more wealth than the bottom 40% of humanity, 3.1 billion people, revealed Oxfam International in its latest research. According to Oxfam estimates, it would take 112 years for an average person in the bottom 50% to make equivalent to what a person in the top 1% makes in a year.

43.title: 19-yr-old Carlos Alcaraz wins 1st round at French Open, defeats Juan Londero
43.article_body: Spain's 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz won his first round at the French Open by defeating Argentina's Juan Ignacio Londero by 6-4, 6-2 and 6-0 on Sunday. The world number 6 tennis player will now meet his fellow countrymate Albert Ramos-Vinolas in the second round on Wednesday. Notably, Alcaraz has already won four titles in the ongoing tennis season.

44.title: Pakistani singer Abrar accuses Karan Johar of stealing his song, threatens legal action
44.article_body: Pakistani singer Abrar Ul Haq accused Karan Johar of stealing his song 'Nach Punjaban' for his production 'Jugjugg Jeeyo'. "I haven't sold my song...to any Indian movie and reserve the rights to go to court to claim damages. Producers like Johar shouldn't use [copied] songs. This is my 6th song being copied which won't be allowed at all...@DharmaMovies," he tweeted.

45.title: What he does I have only seen Zaheer, Nehra do it: Sehwag on Arshdeep
45.article_body: Talking about PBKS fast bowler Arshdeep Singh, who received his maiden Team India call-up for the T20I series against South Africa, Virender Sehwag said, "He's the bowler who bowls one over with the new ball and two in the slog overs." "I have only seen Zaheer Khan and Ashish Nehra do that during my time," he added.

46.title: China 'flirting with danger', US will defend Taiwan if it's invaded: US Prez Biden
46.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said that the US would defend Taiwan militarily if China invaded the self-ruled island, warning that China was "flirting with danger". "That's the commitment we made," he said, adding, "We agreed with the One China policy, we signed on to it...but the idea that it can be taken by force is just not appropriate."

47.title: 16-year-old Jharkhand boy seen kicking girl in school uniform on camera arrested
47.article_body: A 16-year-old boy, who was seen kicking a girl in a school uniform in a video that went viral on social media, has been arrested. Police said that the boy is being sent to a remand home and an investigation into the matter is underway. Police also said that the matter is being said to be a love affair.

48.title: PM Modi pens op-ed on India-Japan relations, writes 'The best is yet to come'
48.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, who is in Japan for two days, has penned an op-ed in a leading Japanese daily. He wrote, "We've traversed a long distance since we established diplomatic relations in 1952. In my view...the best is yet to come." PM Modi also added that India and Japan will contribute towards building an open, free and inclusive Indo-Pacific region.

49.title: Auto stocks trade higher after Centre cuts excise duty on fuel; Maruti up by 4%
49.article_body: Shares of automobile companies traded higher during intraday trade on Monday after the central government announced a cut in excise duty on petrol and diesel. While the BSE Auto Index rose by 2.2%, shares of Ashok Leyland jumped by 5%, Maruti Suzuki India rose 4%, Mahindra and Mahindra climbed 3% and Tata Motors Ltd was up by 1.5%.

50.title: Gurugram civic body renames Vatika Chowk to Shaheed Udham Singh Chowk
50.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram has officially renamed the city's Vatika Chowk, located on Sohna Road, to Shaheed Udham Singh Chowk. The decision to rename was taken in December last year by the MCG's five-member road naming and renaming committee (RNRC). Notably, Vatika Chowk was named after an early 2000s real estate project which took place nearby the junction.

51.title: 19-yr-old held in Ahmedabad's Vejalpur with drugs worth ₹7 lakh
51.article_body: A 19-year-old man was arrested by the Ahmedabad Police's Detection of Crime Branch (DCB) unit for the possession of Mephedrone (MD) drugs worth ₹7 lakh in Vejalpur on Sunday. "He told us that he is himself a drug addict...He makes small zipper pouches of one gram MD and sells them for ₹2,000-2,500 each," an official said.

52.title: Gujarat man stabs businessman 12 times, robs him of gold to pay kids' fees
52.article_body: A man, Vala Gadhvi, from Kutch area of Gujarat has been arrested for allegedly killing a Mumbai businessman, Manu Satra, by stabbing him 12 times. Gadhvi also robbed him of gold ornaments for paying the school fees of his children. Police said Gadhvi had taken Satra to secluded place to show him land, which he said was up for sale.

53.title: Nitish Rana's 'Things will change soon' tweet after Team India snub goes viral
53.article_body: After not being selected in Team India's 18-member squad for the five-match T20I series against South Africa, KKR batter Nitish Rana tweeted, "Things will change soon." After the tweet went viral, a fan commented, "Can feel for you but the competition is so tight that one needs to keep his A game 90% of the time."

54.title: Moderna, Pfizer making $1,000 profit every second from vaccine monopoly: Oxfam
54.article_body: Oxfam International in its latest research revealed that the COVID-19 pandemic created 40 new pharma billionaires and alleged that companies like Moderna and Pfizer are making $1,000 profit every second from their monopoly control of COVID-19 vaccines. It also said these companies are charging governments up to 24 times more than the potential cost of generic production.

55.title: List shows teams with most sixes in IPL 2022 as tally crosses 1,000
55.article_body: As many as 1,001 sixes have been hit in IPL 2022, marking the first instance of at least 1,000 sixes getting smashed in one season of IPL. RR, who finished second on the points table, have slammed the most sixes (116), followed by KKR's 113 and PBKS' 110. Meanwhile, table-toppers GT have slammed the least amount of sixes (69).

56.title: Namaz not offered on roads on Eid for 1st time in UP: CM Yogi
56.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said that for the first time, namaz on Eid and Alvida Juma (last Friday of Ramadan) was not offered on roads in the state. "Ram Navami was celebrated in a grand manner in UP," CM Yogi added. "Earlier, there used to be riots in Muzaffarnagar, Meerut, Moradabad and other places," CM Yogi stated.

57.title: Afghan male news anchors wear masks after Taliban asks women to cover faces
57.article_body: Afghanistan's TOLOnews male presenters on Sunday appeared on air with face masks in solidarity with the female anchors of the agency. This comes after the Taliban ordered all TV broadcasters to ensure that female presenters cover their faces on air. Many Afghan news anchors, who had defied the order earlier, wore face coverings after their employers were allegedly pressured.

58.title: After 'Dil...', got offer to play mom to man who was 10 yrs younger: Swastika
58.article_body: Swastika Mukherjee has said that people started bracketing her in mother roles after 'Dil Bechara'. "I got offers to play mother to a man who was around 10 years younger [than] me. I said I can't play a mother to a 30-year-old," the 41-year-old actress said, adding, "Actors getting typecast needs to change. With women, it needs to break more."

59.title: He stitched my 1st suit: Abhishek mourns death of suit stylist Akbar Shahpurwala
59.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan took to Instagram on Sunday to pen a note, mourning the demise of suit stylist Akbar Shahpurwala. "I knew him as Akki uncle," he wrote, adding, "He made my father's costumes...He personally cut...and stitched my first ever suit as a baby (I still have it)." "To me, he was the best suitmaker in the world," Abhishek further wrote.

60.title: Man falls off flyover, dies after car hits two-wheeler in B'luru
60.article_body: A man died after falling off a flyover in Bengaluru on Sunday after an alleged speeding car hit his two-wheeler. The deceased had purportedly halted his vehicle on the flyover to show a child, who was riding with him, the flights taking off from an aerodrome nearby when the incident took place. The child was also reportedly injured.

61.title: COVID-19 created a new billionaire every 30 hours: Oxfam at WEF in Davos
61.article_body: The COVID-19 pandemic created a new billionaire every 30 hours, said Oxfam International on Monday at the World Economic Forum in Davos. It said 573 people became new billionaires during the pandemic, at the rate of one every 30 hours. Oxfam noted that billionaires' wealth has risen more in the first 24 months of COVID-19 than in 23 years combined.

62.title: Kourtney Kardashian shares pics from her 3rd wedding ceremony with Travis Barker in Italy
62.article_body: American media personality Kourtney Kardashian took to Instagram to share pictures from her third wedding ceremony with Travis Barker in Italy's Portofino. "Happily ever after," Kourtney captioned her post. The couple had tied the knot in Las Vegas in April before getting legally married in Santa Barbara in a courthouse privately.

63.title: My wife gets mad when I take public planes: Tyson after punching a man on flight
63.article_body: After he left a man bloodied during an altercation on a flight, boxing legend Mike Tyson claimed that the man threw a bottle of water at him before the attack. "He was f*****g with me. I took pictures with [him]. I shouldn't even be taking public planes," he said. "My wife gets mad when I take public planes," he added.

64.title: India's ASHA workers get WHO award, PM Modi tweets 'Delighted'
64.article_body: ASHA workers have been honoured with the WHO Director-General's Global Health Leaders Award. The WHO said, "ASHA honoured for their crucial role in linking the community with the health system, to ensure those living in rural poverty can access primary health care services, as shown throughout the pandemic." PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "Delighted...Their dedication and determination is admirable."

65.title: Vijay to reunite with 'Master' director Lokesh Kanagaraj for a film
65.article_body: Actor Vijay and 'Master' director Lokesh Kanagaraj are reuniting for a film temporarily titled, 'Thalapathy 67'. The director at an event said that the film will be a "combination of mass and class". 'Master', which was released in 2021, also featured Vijay Sethupathi and Malavika Mohanan. In addition to 'Thalapathy 67', Vijay will also be seen in Vamshi Paidipally's film.

66.title: Need to have structures to ensure technology doesn't shape us: Ram Madhav
66.article_body: RSS leader Ram Madhav said we are entering an era where machines that we trained are going to be more intelligent than humans. "Technology is our creation. It needs to be contained, just as we have physical highways, we need to have proper structures to ensure technology does not shape us," Madhav added.

67.title: Japan's Indian community has made pioneering contributions: PM Modi
67.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday thanked the Indian community in Japan for a "warm welcome" as he arrived there for the Quad Leaders Summit in Tokyo. He said that Japan's Indian community has made "pioneering contributions" in different fields and remained connected to its Indian roots. PM Modi also shared pictures which show him greeting the Indian diaspora there.

68.title: Govt warns SBI users of fake message claiming their account has been blocked
68.article_body: PIB's Fact Check Twitter account has warned SBI users against a fake message in circulation that tells customers that their account has been blocked. The fake message read, "Dear A/c holder your SBI Bank documents has expired A/c will be blocked. Now Click http://sbikvs.II Update by NetBanking." It also asked users to not respond to such messages and emails.

69.title: Man fined for assaulting civic official in Gurugram
69.article_body: A man was fined for assaulting an on-duty official from the Swachh Bharat Mission team of the Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) in the city. The accused, who is a resident of Badshahpur, allegedly broke the official's cellphone as well. The accused was let off with a warning after he apologised and paid the compensation, an MCG official said.

70.title: Strong winds uproot trees, rains cause water-logging in Delhi, Gurugram
70.article_body: Trees were uprooted and several parts of the city experienced water-logging as rains and strong winds lashed Delhi on Monday morning. Several parts of Gurugram also faced water-logging after rainfall. Meanwhile, rain and thunderstorm have brought temperature of the national capital down. "Today, just from 5:40 am till 7 am, the temperature fell by 11 degrees Celsius," IMD said.

71.title: Can be well-settled without getting married: Kiara on question about marriage
71.article_body: On being asked about marriage at the trailer launch of her upcoming movie 'JugJugg Jeeyo', actress Kiara Advani said, "I can be well-settled without getting married too. I am well-settled, working, earning and I am happy." Kiara is reportedly dating actor Sidharth Malhotra. However, there were also reports of the two breaking up recently.

72.title: 4 held for robbing money collection agent of ₹6.5 lakh in Gurugram
72.article_body: Four people were arrested for allegedly robbing a 28-year-old money collection agent of ₹6.5 lakh in Gurugram's DLF Phase 2. Out of the four accused, one of them earlier used to work in the victim's, identified as Vinod Kumar, company and was aware of the process, police said. Some valuable items and ₹4.8 lakh cash have been recovered.

73.title: Surface temperature in Delhi fell by 11°C amid thunderstorms: IMD
73.article_body: The surface temperature in Delhi fell by 11°C in the period between 5.40 am and 7 am on Monday, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD). The temperature dropped from 29°C to 18°C during the period, IMD said. This comes as the national capital witnessed thunderstorms and winds with a maximum speed of up to 70 kmph the same day.

74.title: Mars Wrigley introduces new Kesar Pista flavoured Snickers
74.article_body: Announcing the launch of a new flavour of Snickers, Mars Wrigley stated that Snickers Kesar Pista brings together a unique combination of the spice Saffron and the nut Pistachio. This flavour combination is often found in several variations of sweets prepared across India, the company added. "It's a very delicate flavour," said Varun Kandhari, Marketing Director, Mars Wrigley India.

75.title: Was drunk: Accused on assaulting mentally ill man who was found dead in MP
75.article_body: Police said that Dinesh Kushwaha, who was arrested after a video of him slapping a mentally ill man in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch went viral, said that he was in an intoxicated state and slapped the man because he wasn't answering his questions. In the viral video, the man could be seen being slapped and asked if his "name is Mohammed".

76.title: Dinesh Karthik shares old pic in India jersey after Team India recall
76.article_body: After being recalled into Team India T20I squad, RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik took to Instagram to share an old picture of himself wearing Team India jersey. "If you believe [in] yourself, everything will fall into place! Thank you for all the support and belief...the hard work continues," he wrote. Karthik had last played a T20I in February 2019.

77.title: HSBC suspends top executive over his comments on climate change: Report
77.article_body: HSBC has reportedly suspended a top executive after he criticised the finance industry for worrying too much about climate change. As per a report, the executive also said, "Climate change isn't a financial risk that we need to worry about…Who cares if Miami is six meters underwater in 100 years, Amsterdam's been six meters underwater for ages...We'll cope with it."

78.title: India reports 2,022 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 14,832
78.article_body: India has reported 2,022 COVID-19 cases, 2,099 recoveries and 46 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,226 COVID-19 cases and 65 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 14,832, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,459.

79.title: Rishi is going to be extremely happy: Neetu on her comeback with 'Jugjugg...'
79.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor, who's set to make her comeback with 'Jugjugg Jeeyo', has said that the film is extremely special for her and that she's proud of it. "I'm sure he (Rishi Kapoor) is going to be extremely happy," she added. Neetu was last seen in the 2013 film 'Besharam', which also featured her late husband Rishi Kapoor.

80.title: Rickshaw driver held for robbing 13-yr-old in Mumbai
80.article_body: An autorickshaw driver was held for allegedly abducting a 13-year-old boy and robbing him of his gold chain in Mumbai. The accused, identified as Samrat Magare (19), allegedly abducted the victim, identified as Sai, when the latter was returning home in the accused's autorickshaw, police said. During police interrogation, Magare returned the stolen 15-gram gold chain.

81.title: Temples damaged by Portuguese should be reconstructed in state: Goa CM
81.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Sunday said that the temples damaged by the "Portuguese" should be reconstructed in the state. "Till date, the tourists were attracted only to beaches but now it's our duty to bring them to temples," Sawant added. The allocation from the budget for reconstruction of temples has already been made, Sawant stated.

82.title: Entry to religious institutions should be at certain age: Assam CM
82.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma on Sunday said entry to any religious institution should be allowed at an age when students can make their own decisions. "Madrasa should be a system of education that can give students the choice to do anything in the future," Biswa added. "Admitting children in madrasas is a violation of their human rights," Biswa stated.

83.title: I have a secret Instagram account to check links friends send me: Musk
83.article_body: The world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk while replying to a follower, revealed that he has "a cheesy secret Instagram account" to click on links that friends send him. He was replying to a Twitter follower who said that many people thought Musk ran his Twitter account, to which Musk replied, "I don't have a burner Twitter account!"

84.title: 38-year-old man gets life term for killing mother-in-law in Pune
84.article_body: A sessions court in Pune has sentenced a 38-year-old man to life imprisonment on charges of murdering his mother-in-law due to frequent domestic issues. The accused was arrested in October 2015 after his mother-in-law was found dead with multiple injuries from a sharp weapon. The court also imposed a fine of ₹10,000 on the accused.

85.title: Wanted to drink with Anil but he said 'we can act it out': Varun on 'JugJugg..'
85.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan, while talking about a drinking scene in his upcoming film 'JugJugg Jeeyo', said that he wanted to actually drink for the scene. "I wanted to actually drink because I wanted to have a drink or two with Anil [Kapoor] sir. But he was like, 'We don't have to. We can just act it out'," he added.

86.title: Saudi Arabia bans travel to India, 15 other countries due to COVID-19
86.article_body: Amid rising cases of COVID-19, Saudi Arabia has banned its citizens from travelling to 16 countries, including India. The other nations include Lebanon, Syria, Turkey, Iran, Afghanistan, Yemen, Somalia, Ethiopia, the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Libya, Indonesia, Vietnam, Armenia, Belarus and Venezuela. The administration added that zero monkeypox cases have been detected in the country.

87.title: Man kills roommate after argument over cleaning house in Navi Mumbai
87.article_body: A 27-year-old man, Manoj Pulvanath Medak, stabbed his 20-year-old roommate, Debajit Dhandhiram Charoh, after an argument over cleaning the house in Navi Mumbai. Police said that Charoh would always be drunk after work and would ask Medak to do the household work. This time, Charoh threw a wooden plank at Medak during the fight, after which Medak stabbed him.

88.title: My demand is for culprits to be hanged to death: Wife of man killed in Hyd
88.article_body: Wife of 20-year-old Neeraj Panwar, who was killed in Hyderabad's Begum Bazar, said her demand is for culprits to be hanged to death. Neeraj was murdered allegedly over his intercaste marriage. Four relatives of his wife, including a minor, were arrested in case. The relatives were reportedly provoked by Neeraj's frequent visits to their locality after marrying against their wishes.

89.title: Kane Williamson blessed with a baby boy, shares pic
89.article_body: New Zealand and SRH captain Kane Williamson has been blessed with his second child, a baby boy. The 31-year-old took to Instagram to share a picture of his wife Sarah Raheem holding their children. He wrote, "Welcome to the whānau little man!" Several cricketers, including Rashid Khan and Ajaz Patel, congratulated the couple.

90.title: Mera naam Wizuki hai, you're welcome in Japan: Class 5 Japanese boy to PM Modi
90.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi reached Japan on Monday to participate in the Quad summit. A Class 5 Japanese boy welcomed PM Modi outside his hotel in Tokyo, saying, "Mera naam Wizuki hai...Japan me aapka bahut swaagat hai (My name is Wizuki. You're welcome in Japan.) PM Modi replied, "Waah! Where did you learn Hindi from? You know it pretty well."

91.title: How does the final IPL 2022 points table read?
91.article_body: PBKS defeated SRH in the last match of league stage in IPL 2022. PBKS finished sixth on the points table with 14 points, while SRH finished eighth on the points table. Table-toppers GT were the only team to win 10 matches in the league stage, while CSK and MI lost 10 matches each.

92.title: Power cuts in several areas in Delhi due to storm, flight operations disrupted
92.article_body: Rain and heavy winds lashed Delhi on Monday, causing power cuts in several parts of the city. Flight operations at the Indira Gandhi International Airport were also disrupted. "Due to bad weather, flight operations at Delhi Airport are affected. Passengers are requested to get in touch with the airline concerned for updated flight information," Delhi Airport said in a tweet.

93.title: Delhi govt planning 45-km-long passage along Asola Bhatti Wildlife Sanctuary
93.article_body: Delhi government is planning to construct a 45-km-long peripheral road alongside the Asola Bhatti Wildlife Sanctuary border, which will function as a patrol passage to boost security. "We've witnessed several incidents of encroachment and trespassing on forest land...anti-social elements also create problems at night. So, this corridor will help us in securing the area," a senior official said.

94.title: Does BJP want to submerge Delhi?: AAP as MCD delays cleaning drains
94.article_body: AAP leader Durgesh Pathak on Sunday asked BJP leaders "if they intend to submerge Delhi" as BJP-run MCD has "not [started] cleaning 95% of drains". "60 foot and smaller drains...come under BJP-run MCD's jurisdiction. These drains aren't yet cleaned even as monsoon is knocking at the door," Pathak said. BJP is playing with lives of lakhs of people, he added.

95.title: They hardly left home: Neighbour of 3 women found dead in Delhi
95.article_body: A day after 54-year-old Manju Devi and her two daughters, Ankita and Anshika, were found dead at their home in Delhi's Vasant Vihar, their neighbour Pammi said the family hardly left their house. "We only saw Anshika leaving the house to buy groceries or feed dogs...We knew their financial condition and offered to help but they refused," Pammi said.

96.title: PBKS chase down 158-run target in 91 balls against SRH, finish 6th on points table
96.article_body: PBKS chased down a target of 158 runs against SRH in 91 balls in the last league stage match to record their seventh victory in IPL 2022. With the victory, PBKS ended their IPL 2022 campaign by finishing sixth on the points table with 14 points. Meanwhile, SRH finished eighth on the points table with 12 points.

97.title: Successful eradication of polio will be super joyful: Bill Gates
97.article_body: Microsoft's Co-founder Bill Gates said, "If we do succeed in polio eradication, that will be super joyful," on being asked about one thing he's bought that's brought him the most joy. "The thing that has succeeded the best so far...is funding vaccines for poor countries through GAVI," Gates added. He further said that he likes burgers and nice tennis racquets.

98.title: Karma is a b***h: Payal as Kangana's 'Dhaakad' records low opening
98.article_body: Payal Rohatgi shared two screenshots on Instagram. The first screenshot was an article which read that Kangana Ranaut's 'Dhaakad' was set to earn ₹50 lakh on Day 1 and the second was an old tweet from Munawar Faruqui. "Karma is a b***h," Payal wrote. "The one who got 18 lakh votes didn't promote the film," she added referring to Munawar.

99.title: 15% export tax may force steel firms to cancel EU orders: JSPL MD
99.article_body: The 15% export tax imposed on eight steel products by the government could force steel companies to cancel European orders and suffer losses, Jindal Steel and Power's (JSPL) Managing Director VR Sharma told Reuters. "[Govt] should've given us...at least 2-3 months of time," Sharma added. He further said that Indian steelmakers have about 2 million tonnes in pending export orders.

100.title: Saudi Arabia bans travel to India, 15 other countries due to COVID-19
100.article_body: Amid rising cases of COVID-19, Saudi Arabia has banned its citizens from travelling to sixteen countries, including India. The other nations include Lebanon, Syria, Turkey, Iran, Afghanistan, Yemen, Somalia, Ethiopia, the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Libya, Indonesia, Vietnam, Armenia, Belarus and Venezuela. The administration added that zero monkeypox cases have been detected in the country.

101.title: Part of 8,000-yr-old human skull found by kayakers in a US river, pic surfaces
101.article_body: Two kayakers recently discovered a partial human skull in a river in Minnesota, US and experts have now determined that the skull is around 8,000 years old. A forensic investigation revealed that the skull is likely that of a man who lived between 5,500 and 6,000 BC. The skull has a depression indicating cause of the man's death.

102.title: Centre trying to connect startups to its ecosystem: MoS IT
102.article_body: Union Minister of State (MoS) for Information Technology Rajeev Chandrasekhar, while addressing students at Gujarat University on Sunday, said, "Innovation, innovation and innovation is the mantra going forward...Our startups and entrepreneurs will drive the Indian economy towards $5 trillion." He further said that the Centre is making efforts to connect startups with its ecosystem.

103.title: 10-year-old girl from Mumbai climbs Mount Everest base camp
103.article_body: A 10-year-old girl from Mumbai has become one of the youngest mountaineers to climb Mount Everest base camp located at a height of 5,364 metres. Class 5 student Rhythm Mamania completed the trek in 11 days with her parents on May 6. Mamania, who's a national level skater, reportedly didn't get any formal training before the trek.

104.title: India sends relief aid worth over ₹43 crore to crisis-hit Sri Lanka
104.article_body: An Indian ship carrying relief aid including food supplies and medicines reached Sri Lanka's Colombo on Sunday as the latter grapples with economic crisis. The consignment, loaded with supplies worth over LKR 2 billion, (₹43.8 crore) was flagged off from Chennai by Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin. India also sent 40,000 metric tonnes of diesel to Sri Lanka on Saturday.

105.title: Govt wanted to convert stadiums into jails for protesting farmers: Kejriwal
105.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, while speaking in Chandigarh on Sunday, said the Centre wanted to convert stadiums into jails to arrest farmers protesting against farm laws, but he didn't give permission. He was accompanied by Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann. "The farmer's agitation was for entire country and not just for...Punjab or Haryana," Kejriwal added.

106.title: Man City score 3 goals in 5 minutes on final day, win 4th Premier League title in 5 years
106.article_body: Manchester City defeated Aston Villa 3-2 on final day to win their fourth Premier League title in five years. Trailing 0-2, Manchester City's İlkay Gündoğan scored in the 76th minute before Rodri equalised in the 78th minute. Gündoğan scored the winning goal in the 81st minute. Manchester City finished the season with 93 points, one point more than second-placed Liverpool.

107.title: Former diplomat shares pic of India, says 'It's not Europe but clean & green Shimla'
107.article_body: Former Norwegian diplomat Erik Solheim on Sunday tweeted a picture of Shimla and wrote, "This is not Europe but clean and green Shimla." "Thank you...for constantly showing the world, the beautiful side of India," a user reacted. Earlier, he had also shared an aerial picture of a beachside road in Karnataka's Udupi, calling it 'world's most beautiful cycling route'.

108.title: Ranveer, Deepika party with Rebecca Hall at Cannes, pics surface
108.article_body: Pictures of actor Ranveer Singh and actress Deepika Padukone partying with British actress Rebecca Hall at the Cannes Film Festival have surfaced online. Deepika is a jury member at the ongoing 75th Cannes Film Festival. Earlier, Deepika and Rebecca had walked the red carpet together at the Cannes Film Festival.

109.title: Govt issues 'high' severity warning for Apple's iPhone, iPad, Watch users
109.article_body: The government's Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-In) has issued a "high" severity warning for Apple's iPhone, iPad, Watch users and a "critical" level warning for Mac users. "Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported...which could be exploited...to execute arbitrary code...and cause denial of service conditions on targeted system," CERT-In said, urging users to apply appropriate updates.

110.title: Religion never teaches animosity: Rahul Gandhi on Neemuch killing
110.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, while condemning the killing of a 65-year-old mentally unstable man in MP's Neemuch, said, "Religion never teaches animosity." Taking to Facebook, Gandhi wrote, "The fire of hate turns men blind and when politics preaches hate, men turn into each other's enemies." Congress leader Kapil Sibal also said, "I'm ashamed that this is happening in my country."

111.title: FRL independent directors facilitated fraudulent transfer of stores: Amazon
111.article_body: Amazon accused the independent directors of Future Retail (FRL) of facilitating "fraudulent" transfer of 835 stores to Reliance Group. It said the "narrative" of failure to pay "huge outstanding rent" to Reliance was a "sham" and that in January, FRL had said its outstanding rent was only ₹250 crore. The handover was a way to "alienate" retail stores, Amazon said.

112.title: Felt energetic & all charged up after losing 98 kgs: Ganesh Acharya
112.article_body: Choreographer Ganesh Acharya said he felt "energetic" and "charged up" after losing 98 kilograms. "This was the best phase to take up a high volume of work...also pursue a little bit of acting," he added. "With pandemic slowing down now and industry running back on track, I have many big projects lined up for this year and next," Ganesh stated.

113.title: Paytm forms general insurance JV, to invest ₹950 cr in 10 years
113.article_body: Paytm parent One97 Communications said it has formed a joint venture general insurance company in which it plans to invest ₹950 crore in 10 years. Following the investment, Paytm will hold 74% stake in Paytm General Insurance, while CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma's VSS Holdings will have a 26% stake. Recently, Paytm's proposed acquisition of Raheja QBE General Insurance was terminated.

114.title: Bangladesh announces health alert amid monkeypox outbreak
114.article_body: Bangladesh has declared a health alert amid rising monkeypox cases around the world. Although no monkeypox case has been detected in Bangladesh yet, incoming foreign travellers from countries where cases have been found will be screened at land, air and seaports. At least 12 countries, including the US, Portugal, UK and Israel, have reported monkeypox cases so far.

115.title: Indian Air Force evacuates people hit by floods in Assam
115.article_body: Continuing its relief efforts in flood-hit areas of Assam, the Indian Air Force evacuated citizens and provided relief material to areas cut off due to the floods. The Air Force has deployed its transport aircraft and helicopters for the task. A total of 26,236 stranded persons have been rescued so far, as per an official bulletin.

116.title: Held direct talks with Turkish Prez Erdoğan: Finland Prez on NATO bid
116.article_body: Finland's President Sauli Niinistö said on Saturday that he had held "open and direct" talks with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdoğan to discuss Finland's NATO membership bid. Turkey has questioned Finland and Sweden's membership in alliance, stating that the countries have ties with a Kurdish militant group. Finland and Sweden need all 30 NATO members' approval to join alliance.

117.title: Kartik trained for a week for Tandav scene in 'Bhool...': Report
117.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan reportedly underwent training for a week for his Tandav scene in his film 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'. "It is a very difficult dance form for someone who has never learnt Indian classical dance," a source stated. "Kartik managed to grab it and how within a week's training under Guru Chinni Prakash," the source added.

118.title: Octopuses eat themselves after mating due to chemical shifts in their bodies: Study
118.article_body: Octopuses torture and eat themselves after mating and before their eggs are hatched due to three chemical changes in their bodies, a new study said. After they lay their eggs, levels of pregnenolone, progesterone hormones and toxic 7-DHC compounds increase in octopuses' bodies. This leads them to beat themselves against rocks, tear their own skins and eat their own arms.

119.title: 'RRR', 'KGF', 'Pushpa' raised the bar of Indian cinema: Karan Johar
119.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, speaking about the success of 'RRR', 'KGF' and 'Pushpa: The Rise', has said, "They have raised the bar of the Indian cinema." "Prashanth Neel ('KGF' director), SS Rajamouli ('RRR' director) and Sukumar ('Pushpa: The Rise' director)...told us how big our standard can be and how far we can reach," Karan stated.

120.title: Cinema not about language, it's about story, emotions: Adah Sharma
120.article_body: Actress Adah Sharma has said that cinema is not about language, adding that cinema is a universal language. "I...speak Marathi and Hindi. We speak Tamil at home. I learned Telugu when I started working in the Telugu film industry. And I speak fluent sign language," the actress added. Adah further said that cinema is about stories, emotions and skills.

121.title: India detects its first cases of BA.4 & BA.5 variants of COVID-19
121.article_body: The first few cases of the BA.4 and BA.5 subvariants of the Omicron COVID-19 variant have been confirmed in India by the Indian SARS-CoV-2 Consortium on Genomics (INSACOG). A 19-year-old female in Tamil Nadu and a South African traveller in Hyderabad have been found positive for BA.4 subvariant. An 80-year-old Telangana man has been found positive for BA.5 subvariant.

122.title: Video shows boy kicking school girl in Jharkhand, CM seeks action
122.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media showing a boy kicking a school girl in a field in Jharkhand's Pakur district. In the purported video, the girl is seen wearing a school uniform. Chief Minister Hemant Soren has asked the police to investigate the matter and inform him after taking action against the accused.

123.title: I wanted to be pilot, 'Top Gun: Maverick' life-changing: Tom Cruise
123.article_body: Hollywood actor Tom Cruise has said that all he ever wanted to be was a pilot or an actor, adding that 'Top Gun: Maverick' was life-changing. "I got to actually fly in an F-14 jet which was a dream come true...The P-51 Mustang you see in the movie is actually my plane," he added. The film was screened at Cannes.

124.title: Crypto regulations will bring peace, more certainty: CoinSwitch CEO
124.article_body: CoinSwitch Kuber's CEO Ashish Singhal has called for regulations in the crypto sector, saying it will bring "peace" and "more certainty". Singhal told Reuters, "Users don't know what will happen with their holdings - is government going to ban, not ban, how is it going to be regulated?" He further said that India should develop a set of crypto laws.

125.title: Putin's missile beheaded my 18-yr-old son, I screamed when I saw him: Ukrainian woman
125.article_body: A Ukrainian woman has said that one of Vladimir Putin's rockets beheaded her 18-year-old son, adding, "I fell to my knees and screamed when I found him like that. I screamed, 'My son, my son, my son!'" "Shrapnel had taken off his head as he bent down trying to shield his girlfriend," she added. His 18-year-old girlfriend also died.

126.title: Scene showing Sidharth Shukla's death cut in 'Jeena...' song: Vishal
126.article_body: Former 'Bigg Boss' contestant Vishal Kotian has revealed that the death scene of late actor Sidharth Shukla was removed from the latter's song 'Jeena Zaroori Hai'. "We didn't want to keep it as it would have been gruesome. If he was alive, we would have kept the scene," he stated. Sidharth passed away, aged 40, due to a heart attack.

127.title: UK wants to send weapons to Moldova amid Russian threat: Truss
127.article_body: The UK wants to send modern weaponry to Ukraine's neighbouring country Moldova to protect the latter from Russian threat, UK's Foreign Secretary Liz Truss has reportedly said. "Putin [wants to] create a greater Russia...Just because his attempts to take Kyiv weren't successful, doesn't mean he's abandoned those ambitions," she added. Moldova is not a member of NATO or the EU.

128.title: Expecting RBI to lift curbs in 3 to 5 months: Paytm Payments Bank
128.article_body: Paytm Payments Bank expects the RBI to lift the curbs it put on the company in the next three to five months, Paytm's Group CFO Madhur Deora told Reuters. In March, RBI ordered a comprehensive audit of the bank's IT systems and barred it from taking on new customers citing "material" supervisory concerns. The bank is assisting RBI, Reuters reported.

129.title: 2,000 acres of encroached land freed in 2 months in Punjab: AAP
129.article_body: AAP on Sunday tweeted that 2,000 acres of encroached land in Punjab has been freed in the last two months. "Without running bulldozers, AAP government is removing encroachment with the public's help," AAP said. "I appeal to those who have illegally occupied...land...to leave the illegal possession by May 31," Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann had tweeted on May 11.

130.title: Video shows the moment lion bites off finger of zookeeper teasing it in Jamaica
130.article_body: A video showing a caged lion biting off a zookeeper's finger in front of visitors in Jamaica has surfaced online. The zookeeper could be seen teasing the lion through its cage before it gripped his finger in its mouth. "When it happened, I thought it was a joke. I didn't realise the seriousness of it," a visitor said.

131.title: No support from govt needed this fiscal: Punjab & Sind Bank MD
131.article_body: Punjab & Sind Bank is sufficiently capitalised to meet expected credit growth in the current fiscal year and may not need support from the government, MD and CEO S Krishnan said. He added that the bank's capital adequacy ratio improved to 18.54% in March 2022 from 17.06% in March 2021. During FY22, the government infused ₹4,600 crore in the bank.

132.title: Told JP Nadda about BJP's shortcomings in Bengal, Kerala: Arjun Singh
132.article_body: Ex-BJP West Bengal Vice-President Arjun Singh said that he had spoken to BJP National President JP Nadda about the party's shortcomings in Bengal and Kerala. "[Nadda had] said that he'll think about it...It's upon the party as a whole how it'll tackle them," he added. Singh, who's BJP's Lok Sabha MP from Barrackpore, rejoined TMC after three years on Sunday.

133.title: 6-yr-old dies after being rescued from 100-ft-deep borewell in 9-hour op in Punjab
133.article_body: A six-year-old boy who had fallen into a 100-feet-deep borewell in Punjab's Hoshiarpur on Sunday died at a hospital after being rescued. The rescue operation continued for nine hours. The boy had climbed a borewell shaft when some stray dogs started chasing him. It was covered with a jute bag and could not withstand his weight.

134.title: She's staying with another man in my house: Actor Karan on estranged wife Nisha
134.article_body: Actor Karan Mehra has claimed his estranged wife Nisha Rawal has been staying with "another man" in his house for the past 11 months. "He has entered my house, leaving his wife and children," said Mehra, adding that Rawal and the man have 'snatched' his properties, cars and businesses. Rawal had accused Mehra of domestic abuse last year.

135.title: DC skipper Rishabh Pant has got my full backing: Head coach Ponting
135.article_body: Delhi Capitals head coach Ricky Ponting has said that captain Rishabh Pant has got his full backing after DC were knocked out of IPL 2022 playoffs race by Mumbai Indians on Saturday. "No doubt in my mind...Rishabh, even in the last season, was the right choice for the captain...He's just a young man and still learning captaincy," Ponting added.

136.title: Former champion Garbiñe Muguruza knocked out of French Open 2022 in first round
136.article_body: World number 10 and Roland Garros 2016 champion Garbiñe Muguruza was knocked out of French Open 2022 in the women's singles first round. Muguruza lost 6-2, 3-6, 4-6 to world number 46 Kaia Kanepi in two hours and six minutes. Meanwhile, world number six Ons Jabeur also crashed out of the tournament after losing to Magda Linette in first round.

137.title: Number of monkeypox cases in 12 countries released by WHO
137.article_body: The WHO has released the number of monkeypox cases reported in non-endemic countries between May 13 and 21. Spain, UK and Portugal have 21-30 confirmed cases, with Spain having 6-10 suspected cases. While Canada has 1-5 confirmed cases, it is believed to have 11-20 suspected cases. Meanwhile, US, Germany, Australia, Italy and France are among the nations with 1-5 cases.

138.title: All local languages are national languages under NEP: Union Minister
138.article_body: Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said on Saturday that all local languages in the country are deemed as national languages under the new National Education Policy (NEP). "The local languages are no less important than any other languages used in this country, be it Hindi or English. This is the main feature of this NEP," he added.

139.title: Kylian Mbappe extends contract with Paris Saint-Germain until 2025
139.article_body: Paris Saint-Germain forward Kylian Mbappe has extended his contract with the club until 2025. This comes after several reports had stated that Mbappe would be joining Real Madrid on free transfer once his contract with PSG runs out. "I'm convinced...here I can continue to grow at a club that provides everything necessary to perform at the highest level," he added.

140.title: SRH to bat first against PBKS in last league stage match of IPL 2022, playing XIs out
140.article_body: SRH won the toss and elected to bat first against PBKS in the last league stage match of IPL 2022 on Sunday. SRH are being led by Bhuvneshwar Kumar in the absence of Kane Williamson. Romario Shepherd and Jagadeesha Suchith have been included in SRH's playing XI, while PBKS have included Nathan Ellis, Shahrukh Khan and Prerak Mankad.

141.title: Heaps of garbage seen in Kedarnath amid Char Dham Yatra, pics surface
141.article_body: Pictures and videos shared by the media have shown piles of garbage and refuse strewn about at campsites in Uttarakhand's Kedarnath amid the Char Dham Yatra. This came as the Yatra resumed this year after two years of suspension due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The increased human activity and garbage are destroying the area's flora, experts have warned.

142.title: Farmers can topple governments: Telangana CM KCR in Punjab
142.article_body: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao on Sunday, after paying tribute to the farmers who died during the anti-farm laws protests last year, said, "Farmers can topple governments." Urging farmers' leaders to not stop their agitation against the Centre, Rao said, "We...would always support our farmer brothers and sisters." Telangana is improving, giving farmers free electricity, he added.

143.title: FPIs remain net sellers, withdraw ₹35,137 crore between May 2-20
143.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew net ₹35,137 crore during May 2-20, data with depositories showed. After turning net investors for the first time in six months between April 1-8, FPIs turned net sellers again during April 11-13 week and have remained negative since then. The net outflow of FPIs from equities has reached ₹1.63 lakh crore so far in 2022.

144.title: Get Tripathi to Aus for T20 WC, he's dangerous striker of ball: Hayden
144.article_body: Ex-Australia batter Matthew Hayden has said that SRH batter Rahul Tripathi is a dangerous striker of the ball. "You get him to Australia (for the T20 WC 2022) because he can play those brilliant shots on the bouncy pitches there," Hayden added. In the IPL 2022, Tripathi has scored 393 in 13 matches so far at an average of 39.30.

145.title: PM Modi, US Prez Biden to have discussion on Ukraine situation on May 24
145.article_body: PM Narendra Modi and US President Joe Biden, during a bilateral meeting in Tokyo on May 24 (Tuesday), will have a constructive and straightforward dialogue along with a continued discussion on the Ukraine situation. US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said, "It'll be a continuation of the conversation they have already had on how we see the picture in Ukraine."

146.title: Got acting coach for 'Jugjugg Jeeyo', acting different now: Neetu
146.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor stated that she hired an acting coach for 'Jugjugg Jeeyo' and took acting and diction classes. "When I was working earlier in the '70s and '80s, our acting was very animated and loud. Today, it has become subtle," the actress added. She further said it helped her get out of depression after her husband Rishi Kapoor's demise.

147.title: Israel reports 1st monkeypox case, asks foreign returnees to get tested
147.article_body: Israel has detected its first monkeypox case in a man who returned from abroad, authorities have confirmed. The country's health ministry said the man has been admitted to a hospital in Tel Aviv and is stable, additionally asking foreign returnees with fever and lesions to visit a doctor. Monkeypox cases have been reported in US, Portugal, UK, among other countries.

148.title: T Natarajan has lost some rhythm since returning from injury: Aakash
148.article_body: Ex-India batter Aakash Chopra has said that SRH pacer T Natarajan lost "some rhythm" after returning from injury. In the match against Mumbai Indians on Tuesday, Natarajan conceded 60 runs in his four-over bowling spell. Speaking about his performance versus MI, Aakash said, "He struggled to get his yorkers right. He was trying, but it was...not coming out right."

149.title: Video shows man standing on two moving SUVs in Noida; arrested
149.article_body: A 21-year-old man has been arrested for performing dangerous stunts on vehicles and bikes in Sector-113 in Noida. A video posted by the Uttar Pradesh Police shows the man standing on two moving SUVs on a city road. Police have also seized the two SUVs and a motorcycle used by him in stunts.

150.title: Shared a room with my cook when I moved to Mumbai: Ayushmann
150.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana has revealed in an interview that when he moved to Mumbai, he shared a room with his cook. He said that he brought his cook with him because he can't live without food. "He didn't have any place to stay so I was like you stay in my room but I need a cook," the actor added.

151.title: Maharashtra cuts VAT on petrol by ₹2.08 per litre, diesel by ₹1.44 per litre
151.article_body: The Maharashtra government on Sunday announced a VAT reduction of ₹2.08 per litre on petrol and ₹1.44 per litre on diesel with immediate effect. This comes after the Centre on Saturday announced reduction in central excise duty on petrol by ₹8 per litre and diesel by ₹6 per litre in order to ease inflation.

152.title: There's no competition: Karan on South films doing better than Hindi
152.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar, on being asked about South Indian films performing better at the box office than Hindi films, said that there is no competition and it's about growing together. "We have to be one collective unit, one cinema," he added. The filmmaker further said that Hindi films are getting back on track with 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' and 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'.

153.title: Quad to discuss progress of initiatives, issues of mutual interest: PM
153.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said on Sunday that the Quad Leaders Summit in Tokyo will review the progress of initiatives undertaken by the group. "We'll...exchange views about developments in...Indo-Pacific region and global issues of mutual interest,” he added. PM Modi, who will attend summit in Tokyo on May 24, will also hold bilateral meetings with leaders of US, Australia and Japan.

154.title: Arjun Singh, former West Bengal BJP Vice-President, rejoins TMC after 3 years
154.article_body: BJP Lok Sabha MP Arjun Singh on Sunday joined the Trinamool Congress after quitting the BJP. Singh, who was the West Bengal BJP's Vice-President, had left the TMC and joined BJP in 2019 ahead of the Lok Sabha election. He joined TMC in the presence of the party's General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee in Kolkata.

155.title: India squad for fifth rescheduled Test against England announced, Pujara recalled
155.article_body: The BCCI today announced a 17-member Team India squad for the fifth rescheduled Test against England. Cheteshwar Pujara has been recalled to the squad after having been dropped for the home Test series against Sri Lanka. The squad also includes Prasidh Krishna, KS Bharat, Mohammed Siraj and Umesh Yadav. The Test will take place from July 1 in Edgbaston.

156.title: Businessman Sunil Chopra elected Mayor of London borough for 2nd time
156.article_body: Delhi-born businessman Sunil Chopra has been elected as the Mayor of the Borough of Southwark in the UK's London for the second time. Chopra became the first Indian-origin person to hold the Mayor's office in Southwark in 2014 when he was elected there for the first time. He also held the office of Southwark's Deputy Mayor from 2013 to 2014.

157.title: 8,640 bottles of banned cough syrup seized in Thane, 2 arrested
157.article_body: Over 8,640 bottles of cough syrup with the banned narcotic drug codeine have been seized from Maharashtra's Thane district, officials said on Sunday. The Narcotics Control Bureau has arrested two persons in this connection. The bottles, collectively weighing 864 kg, were kept in 60 boxes in their car.

158.title: Team India squad for T20I series against South Africa announced; Rohit, Kohli rested
158.article_body: India squad for the five-match T20I series against South Africa has been announced. Captain Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli and Jasprit Bumrah have been rested, while KL Rahul has been appointed the captain for the series. Dinesh Karthik and Hardik Pandya return to the squad, while SRH pacer Umran Malik and PBKS pacer Arshdeep Singh have been given a maiden call-up.

159.title: Pune RTO to soon conduct drive against illegally modified e-bikes
159.article_body: Pune Regional Transport Office (RTO) will soon conduct a drive to check the use of illegally modified e-bikes, officials said. E-bikes with battery capacity of less than 250 watts and speed limit of 25 km/hour are exempted from registration. "It's found that some manufacturers are...later increasing the battery capacity and [the bike's range]," said Pune Regional Transport Officer Ajit Shinde.

160.title: This is how the Britishers came and divided us: Akshay Kumar on north-south cinema debate
160.article_body: Reacting to the north-south cinema debate, Akshay Kumar said, "I think we should stop asking this question." Adding that "we are all a common industry", Akshay said, "It's important that we understand...this is how the Britishers came and divided us, they invaded us and ruled us. We don’t seem to have learnt our lesson, we are still not understanding this."

161.title: Sitharaman compares development spendings before & after 2014 after fuel price cut
161.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman clarified that the burden of recent petrol and diesel price cut will be borne by the Centre and compared developmental expenditure incurred by governments before and after 2014. "Expenditure incurred by the [Narendra Modi-led] govt during 2014-22 was ₹90.9 lakh crore...Only ₹49.2 lakh crore was spent on developmental expenditure during 2004-14," she stated.

162.title: I never compromised: Kangana on not doing item songs, endorsing fairness creams
162.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut said she never did any item song or endorsed fairness creams even when she started her career. "I never did anything because of which I've to compromise now," she added. "Even when you look at my history, you'll never find anything controversial...I started taking a stand when I felt that I'm at a certain level," Kangana said.

163.title: Woman caught me at a Pune premiere for 2-3 minutes, I was stuck there: Bobby
163.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol, while recalling a moment with a female fan at a premiere in Pune, said that she "caught" him and didn't let go for two-three minutes. "I was like...how do I get out of here...I was stuck. I couldn't even push her, I didn't know what to do," Bobby said, adding that he understands the excitement of fans.

164.title: Govt launches single national portal for biotech startups
164.article_body: MoS for Science Jitendra Singh on Saturday launched a single national portal for India's biotech startups and researchers. The portal, Biological Research Regulatory Approval Portal (BioRRAP), will serve as a single window clearance for those seeking regulatory approval for biological research and development. Singh said India will be among the top 5 global bio-manufacturing hubs by 2025.

165.title: Actors have PR machinery to scream their achievements; I don't have it: Abhay
165.article_body: Actor Abhay Deol said all actors have "PR machinery" and it's a "marketing thing". "Actors have PR machinery. I didn't back then and I still don't. It's become...part of the job profile to have media behind you," he added. "It's like you have to scream your achievements out to people and I've always been shy of that," Abhay said.

166.title: Wicket was slow, had low bounce: Bumrah on Wankhede pitch
166.article_body: After beating DC by 5 wickets in their last game of IPL 2022 on Saturday, MI pacer Jasprit Bumrah has said that the pitch at the Wankhede Stadium was "slow". "The wicket is quite fast here, there's pace and bounce. But this (today's pitch) was slow, and the bounce was low. There wasn't much swing," Bumrah said.

167.title: Govt didn't inform before hiking fuel taxes, now asking states to cut them: TN minister
167.article_body: Tamil Nadu Finance Minister Dr P Thiaga Rajan took to Twitter after the Centre reduced excise duty on petrol and diesel. Rajan wrote, "The Union Government didn't inform, let alone ask for any state's view when they increased Union taxes on petrol...and...diesel...Now, after rolling back approximately 50% of their increases, they're exhorting states to cut."

168.title: 6-yr-old Punjab boy falls into 100-ft-deep borewell, rescue ops on
168.article_body: A six-year-old boy fell into a 100-feet-deep borewell in Punjab's Hoshiarpur on Sunday, officials said, adding that a rescue operation is underway. He was playing in a field when some stray dogs started chasing him. He climbed the borewell shaft that was covered with a jute bag, but it could not withstand the weight of the boy.

169.title: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan hugs fan at Cannes, video goes viral
169.article_body: A video going viral on social media shows a fan of actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan hugging her at the 2022 Cannes Film Festival. Another fan can be heard saying, "So lucky," as Aishwarya returns the hug. Aishwarya tells her fans, "God bless and take care." A social media user commented, "Most humble actress," while another wrote, "Love her attitude."

170.title: Sun Pharma recalls 10,548 bottles of anti-depression drug in US
170.article_body: India's largest drugmaker Sun Pharma is recalling 10,548 bottles of bupropion hydrochloride extended-release tablets, a generic anti-depression drug, in the US market. As per the US Food and Drug Administration (USFDA), a customer found a "dark, gritty substance" inside one bottle. The affected lot of the medication was manufactured by Sun Pharma in its manufacturing plant in Gujarat's Halol.

171.title: Wearing burqa isn't Afghan tradition: Ex-Prez on Taliban's new decree
171.article_body: Reacting to the Taliban's recent decree demanding Afghan women to fully cover themselves in public spaces, ex-President Hamid Karzai said that wearing the burqa isn't an Afghan tradition. He added that the use of the burqa came to the country 200-300 years ago. Karzai also condemned the Taliban's decision to keep high schools closed to girls, calling the move "unfortunate".

172.title: Lataji performed barefoot at London's Royal Albert Hall: Javed Ali
172.article_body: Singer Javed Ali has revealed that late veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar came on stage barefoot at London's Royal Albert Hall. He added that late veteran actor Dilip Kumar introduced her and, when she came without slippers, asked her to wear them. "Lataji refused and said, 'I never sing a song wearing slippers as for me it's a prayer'," Javed said.

173.title: Jeremy Renner to star in biopic about US opioid epidemic
173.article_body: Jeremy Renner, known for playing Hawkeye in Marvel Cinematic Universe, has signed on to play the role of Pulitzer-winning investigative reporter David Armstrong, who helped expose the Sackler family's links to the US opioid epidemic. The project will be penned and directed by Aron Gaudet and Gita Pullapilly. More than 450,000 Americans died from opioid use from 1999 to 2016.

174.title: Didn't want to say 'we're just friends': Rakul on her relationship with Jackky
174.article_body: Speaking about her relationship with her boyfriend, producer Jackky Bhagnani, actress Rakul Preet Singh said, "We don't want to hide and say 'we're just good friends'." "We want to acknowledge that. But do I want it to be a talking point? The answer is no...My work should speak. Both of us are on our own individual journeys," she added.

175.title: Rahul Baba must take out his Italian specs: Amit Shah
175.article_body: Criticising Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over his recent remarks on the BJP-ruled Centre, Union Home Minister Amit Shah has said that "Rahul baba must take out his Italian specs". "He (Rahul) must have a look at the development work done by PM Modi & CM Pema Khandu," said Shah while laying the foundation stone of various projects in Arunachal Pradesh.

176.title: UP govt schools to get loudspeakers removed from religious places
176.article_body: According to Uttar Pradesh district officials, loudspeakers that have been removed from religious places in the state are being given to government schools.
