Schools can use loudspeakers for educational purposes, Gorakhpur DM Vijay Kiran Anand said. Lucknow DM Abhishek Prakash said that while Gorakhpur has started the distribution, the state capital will begin the process next week.

177.title: Was born in India: TMC's Alo Rani Sarkar on being ruled B'deshi national
177.article_body: Trinamool Congress' Alo Rani Sarkar said on Saturday that she was born in India in 1969. She added that her family permanently moved to the country in 1971, further stating that she has ancestral property in Bangladesh. Her remarks come after Calcutta HC ruled her Bangladeshi while dismissing her petition challenging verdict of her constituency's result in Bengal Assembly polls.

178.title: Don't want to leave space uncontested for BJP: Mehbooba Mufti
178.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti said her party will contest the upcoming J&K panchayat elections as she "does not want to leave any space uncontested for BJP". I am not going to be in power politics for quite sometime now, Mufti said. "To thwart [BJP's] designs, if [political parties] have to come together and fight elections unitedly, why not?" she added.

179.title: Day 3 of AMU Lit Fest cancelled, students protest against admin decision
179.article_body: On Sunday, the Aligarh Muslim University's administration cancelled day 3 events of the AMU Literature Festival 2022. The event was temporarily cancelled on Saturday but later resumed, students said. However, an AMU professor told the Quint that the fest had been cancelled due to "logistical reasons". Notably, the three-day fest is organised by AMU's University Debating and Literary Club.

180.title: Aligarh Police warn residents against provocative social media comments
180.article_body: The Aligarh Police have warned the residents against posting provocative and communally sensitive comments on social media. "Careless approach on the part of an individual while posting irresponsible comments on social media might land him or her behind the bars. The Aligarh Police are keeping a close vigil on those indulging in such activities," Kalanidhi Naithani, SSP, said.

181.title: Illegal B'luru hookah bar raided; cash, items worth ₹50,000 seized
181.article_body: Joint Commissioner of Police, Raman Gupta, took to Twitter to share that the CCB Anti Narcotics squad raided a hookah bar in Bengaluru. He mentioned in his tweet that two people who were operating the bar illegally have been apprehended. The tweet further said that hookah packets, flavours, cash and other items worth ₹50,000 were seized during the raid.

182.title: Not fair that South films are doing well & we're like 'okay this is also us': Aditi
182.article_body: Actress Aditi Rao Hydari has said that people are realising films from South India are part of the Indian film industry after several big successes, adding, "We should have done it earlier." She said, "It is not fair that they are doing well and suddenly we are like 'okay this is also us.' We need to be more inclusive."

183.title: Everybody should be concerned about monkeypox: US Prez after cases in 12 countries
183.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Sunday said that everybody should be concerned about the monkeypox outbreak. He added, "We're working on it hard to figure out what we do and what vaccine, if any, may be available for it." This comes after the WHO confirmed 92 monkeypox cases across 12 countries that are not endemic for monkeypox virus.

184.title: Entire burden of excise duty cuts on petrol, diesel is borne by Centre: FM
184.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Sunday tweeted that the entire burden of the duty cuts on petrol and diesel announced yesterday and in November 2021 is being borne by the Centre. "Excise duty reduction...has entirely been made in Road & Infrastructure Cess," Sitharaman explained, adding that the Basic Excise Duty, which is sharable with the states, has not been touched.

185.title: Hello...Period: Biden in message for Kim during his 1st Asia visit as US Prez
185.article_body: US President Joe Biden when asked in South Korea's Seoul what message he had for North Korea's Kim Jong-un, said, "Hello...period." Referring to North Korean nuclear weapons tests, Biden said, "We are prepared for anything North Korea does. I'm not concerned." Biden is on his first visit to Asia as the US President.

186.title: Veteran playback singer Sangeetha Sajith passes away at 46
186.article_body: Veteran South Indian playback singer Sangeetha Sajith passed away on Sunday morning at the age of 46. She was reportedly suffering from kidney-related ailments. She died at her sister's residence in Thiruvananthapuram. Sangeetha has sung over 200 film songs in various South Indian languages, including Malayalam, Tamil, Telugu and Kannada.

187.title: They are going to have sleepless nights: Shastri on Pant not taking DRS against Tim David
187.article_body: Talking about DC captain Rishabh Pant opting not to take DRS against MI's Tim David after a caught behind appeal, Ravi Shastri said that Pant should've taken the review as it was a "no-brainer". Shastri added DC players are going to have sleepless nights over this. David, who could've been dismissed for 0(1), scored 34(11) to help MI win.

188.title: How did CSK finish on IPL points table over the years?
188.article_body: CSK managed to win just four matches in IPL 2022, finishing ninth on the points table, their worst performance in an IPL season. CSK's previous worst performance had come in IPL 2020, when they finished seventh with six victories. CSK have recorded a top-two finish on IPL points table in seven of their 13 seasons.

189.title: Was forced to act in 'Naane...' as an actor didn't turn up: Maker Selvaraghavan
189.article_body: 'Naane Varuven' director Selvaraghavan has revealed that he was "forced" to act in the film. "It was not my intention," he added. "Last minute the actor didn't turn up...there was no one for the role and it is a very important character. There was no pre-planning," Selvaraghavan said. The upcoming film also stars his actor-brother Dhanush.

190.title: Israeli forces kill 17-yr-old Palestinian militant during clashes
190.article_body: Israeli forces shot dead a 17-year-old Palestinian militant on Saturday during clashes in West Bank, according to the Palestinian Health Ministry and local media. The Israeli military said that its soldiers had opened fire after gunmen shot at them from a passing vehicle and threw explosives. Meanwhile, Palestinian Islamic Jihad said that the deceased teenager was one of its members.

191.title: Deadly gas, don't light match: Note at Delhi flat after woman, 2 daughters are found dead
191.article_body: Delhi Police have recovered a warning note from the flat where a 54-year-old woman and her two daughters, aged 27 and 25, were found dead due to suspected suicide. "Too much deadly gas...carbon monoxide inside...Do not light match, candle...Do not inhale," the warning note read. Police said the family had been depressed since the woman's husband died last year.

192.title: Worked really hard on my shape: MI's Tim David
192.article_body: After scoring a match-winning 34(11) against Delhi Capitals on Saturday, Mumbai Indians batter Tim David revealed that he has worked hard on his "shape". "Early in the season I was leaning back on the ball...so I've worked really hard on my shape," David said. "Had to hold my shape...got lucky with a couple of baby sixes," the Singaporean cricketer said.

193.title: Who is Ankiti Bose, the Indian-origin Co-founder of Zilingo who was fired as CEO?
193.article_body: Ankiti Bose is the Indian-origin Co-founder of Singapore-based Zilingo who started the B2B e-commerce startup after visiting Bangkok's Chatuchak Market, one of the world's largest weekend markets. Founded in 2015, Zilingo was valued at nearly $1 billion in 2019, when Bose was 27 years old. Bose has featured on Forbes 30 Under 30 Asia and Fortune 40 Under 40 list.

194.title: She can pull any kind of look: Deepika's makeup artist on her Cannes looks
194.article_body: French makeup and hair expert Florian Hurel, who has worked with the actress Deepika Padukone, spoke about her Cannes 2022 looks. She said, "Deepika is one such actress who is always ready to experiment with her looks...She can pull any kind of look." "You have to be very confident to carry such a look! Hats off to her!" Florian added.

195.title: Some planned to lay down a trap: MNS chief on cancelling Ayodhya trip
195.article_body: After cancelling his visit to Ayodhya in Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray said, "Those who were rattled by my announcement to visit Ayodhya were planning to lay down a trap." Addressing a rally in Pune, he added that many people did not like his decision to put the plan on hold.

196.title: 57 pilgrims died since onset of Char Dham Yatra 2022
196.article_body: As many as 57 pilgrims have died since the Char Dham Yatra 2022 began on May 3, DG Health, Dr Shailja Bhatt, said on Sunday. "Health screening of pilgrims is being done on Yatra travel routes," Bhatt added. Earlier, the state government mandated registration for the Char Dham Yatra pilgrims before commencing their journey.

197.title: Expert panel led by IIT prof to probe Ramban tunnel collapse
197.article_body: The Centre has constituted a three-member committee, led by IIT Delhi's Professor JT Shahu, to probe the tunnel collapse incident in Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban which killed 10 labourers on Thursday, a government order said. The panel carried out an inspection of the site on Saturday and Sunday and has been asked to submit a detailed report within 10 days.

198.title: Hina unveils poster of 'Country of Blind' at Cannes India Pavilion
198.article_body: Actress Hina Khan unveiled the poster of her second film 'Country of Blind' at the India Pavilion of the 2022 Cannes Film Festival. The film is based on HG Wells' novel of the same name and is directed by Rahat Kazmi. This is Hina's second film poster to be released at the Cannes Film Festival after her debut film 'Lines'.

199.title: We weren't consistent, lost key moments: PBKS head coach Anil Kumble
199.article_body: Punjab Kings head coach Anil Kumble, speaking about his team's IPL 2022 campaign, has said, "The team wasn't consistent." He added, "We...need to find a way to bring better consistency in the coming seasons." PBKS did not qualify for the IPL 2022 playoffs. "We lost key moments...There are a lot of positives, but...disappointed that we couldn't make it," he added.

200.title: Croatian police open fire during clash with soccer fans; many hurt
200.article_body: Croatian police on Saturday opened fire with live ammunition during clashes with soccer fans, who were returning from a match in Zagreb after their team lost, authorities said. The incident occurred when the fans who were travelling in buses under police escort allegedly attacked police officers when the vehicles stopped. Two fans and about a dozen police officers were injured.

201.title: Will consider further cut: K'taka CM after Centre reduces fuel prices
201.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday said the state government "will consider" further cut in fuel tax. His statement comes after the Centre on Saturday announced a ₹8 per litre cut in excise duty on petrol and ₹6 per litre on diesel. "I thank honourable PM Narendra Modi...This is a pro-people decision," Bommai had tweeted following the announcement.

202.title: Ukrainian director criticises Cannes for screening Russian film
202.article_body: Ukrainian director Dmytro Sukholytkyy-Sobchuk has criticised the 2022 Cannes Film Festival for including a Russian director in its line-up. While the official Russian delegations were banned from attending, director Kirill Serebrennikov's in-competition film was premiered at Cannes on Wednesday. "When he's here, he is part of the Russian propaganda and they can use him," Sukholytkyy-Sobchuk said.

203.title: Some players take time to understand because it's a new team: Rohit
203.article_body: After finishing their campaign at IPL 2022 with just four wins, Mumbai Indians skipper Rohit Sharma has said that some players will "take time" to understand their role because it is a "new team". "This season has been disappointing for us because we could not get a lot of things right during the first half," Sharma said.

204.title: Initially Milind bagged the part of Shekhar in 'Jo Jeeta Wohi...': Deepak Tijori
204.article_body: Actor Deepak Tijori revealed that initially, he wasn't a part of 'Jo Jeeta Wohi Sikandar'. "Milind Soman had bagged the part. 75% of the film was shot with him," he said. "Then the makers scrapped the film. It was shut for some time. I knew they had shot it as I had auditioned and I was not selected," he added.

205.title: Raj Thackeray asks PM to change Aurangabad's name to Sambhajinagar
205.article_body: MNS chief Raj Thackeray on Sunday requested PM Narendra Modi to change the name of Aurangabad to Sambhajinagar. "I request the Prime Minister to bring Uniform Civil Code at the earliest, also bring a law on population control," Thackeray added while addressing a rally in Pune. The Pune Police have imposed several conditions for Thackeray's public rally.

206.title: Depp's lawyer laughs on being asked if she's dating him, video viral
206.article_body: A video showing Johnny Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez laughing as a photographer asks her outside the courtroom if she is dating the actor has gone viral online. The photographer can be seen asking her, "Yes or no?" but Camille ignores the question and keeps walking. She also pauses to pet a fan's dog and hugs other fans before moving away.

207.title: Grateful for all the love: Aanand on 7 yrs of 'Tanu weds Manu Returns'
207.article_body: As his film 'Tanu Weds Manu Returns' completed seven years of its release on Sunday, director Aanand L Rai said, "It's great to see that 'Tanu Weds Manu Returns' has amazing re-watch value." "I'm humbled and grateful for all the love that this film has continued to receive," he added. 'Tanu Weds Manu Returns' starred R Madhavan and Kangana Ranaut.

208.title: Foreign national held for cyber fraud in B'luru, 5 fake SIM cards seized
208.article_body: Deputy Commissioner of Police, Anoop A Shetty, took to Twitter to share that the Bengaluru Police have arrested a foreign national who was involved in a cyber fraud using fake SIM cards and bank accounts. The police officer also mentioned in his tweet that five fake SIM cards have been seized from the accused.

209.title: Govt denies reports of ordering ASI to conduct excavation at Qutub Minar complex
209.article_body: After reports claimed that the Ministry of Culture has instructed Archaeological Survey of India to conduct excavation at Qutub Minar, Union Minister G Kishan Reddy said, "No such decision has been taken." This comes after ASI's ex-regional director Dharamveer Sharma claimed that idols of Hindu deities were found in the monument's complex and that it was built by Raja Vikramaditya.

210.title: Major fire breaks out at pharma company in Guj, 10 fire tenders rushed to spot
210.article_body: A major fire broke out in a pharma company in Gujarat's Gandhinagar district on Sunday. Five fire tenders were rushed to the spot after a call about the incident was received at 9 am. "More than five other fire tenders from...Ahmedabad, Gandhinagar, Kalol and Kadi...were also sent," Gandhinagar fire station officer said. Officials said no casualties were reported in incident.

211.title: 400-yr-old public bath found near 'Bibi Ka Maqbara' in Aurangabad, pic surfaces
211.article_body: Remnants of a 400-year-old hammam (public bath) have been found near the 'Bibi Ka Maqbara' (the Taj Mahal's replica) in Maharashtra's Aurangabad. The hammam is located near the entrance of the tomb built by Mughal ruler Aurangzeb in the memory of his first wife Dilras Banu Begum. It might've been meant for use before entering the tomb, ASI officials said.

212.title: Captaincy isn't everyone's cup of tea: Piyush Chawla on Mayank Agarwal
212.article_body: Piyush Chawla has opined that the pressure of leading Punjab Kings was "visible" in Mayank Agarwal's batting in IPL 2022. "The pressure of captaincy is different...it was clearly visible in his batting as well as how he used to look a bit edgy on the field," he said. "Captaincy isn't everyone's cup of tea...it showed clearly here," he added.

213.title: Ashamed this is happening in my country: Kapil Sibal on Neemuch killing
213.article_body: Congress leader Kapil Sibal condemned the killing of a mentally unstable man in Madhya Pradesh’s Neemuch. One man has been arrested for thrashing him to death. "Differently-abled elderly man beaten to death on suspicion of being a Muslim. I am ashamed that this is happening in my country," Sibal tweeted on Sunday.

214.title: IPL betting racket busted in Delhi; 6 arrested, ₹74,740 seized
214.article_body: Delhi Police busted an IPL betting racket operating in Delhi's Nihal Vihar and arrested six persons engaged in it. Police recovered ₹74,740 in cash, 10 mobile phones, two laptops, three internet routers, two LED TVs and other devices from the spot. We acted on a specific input, received by special staff on May 15, to conduct the raid, police said.

215.title: 'Welcome' started off as love story, became comedy during writing: Maker Anees
215.article_body: Filmmaker Anees Bazmee, writer and director of Akshay Kumar-starrer film 'Welcome', revealed that the film "started off as a love story back in the day". "But as the writing progressed, it turned out to be a comedy. The story lent itself to all those quirky characters," he added. 'Welcome' also featured Katrina Kaif, Nana Patekar and Anil Kapoor, among others.

216.title: Road widening work on old Mumbai-Pune highway begins
216.article_body: The road widening work on the old Mumbai-Pune highway in Khadki has begun. The work was stalled for several years and now the Department of Defence has given the approval to hand over the two kilometres of land required for the project. The 42-metre wide road is expected to decongest the area.

217.title: Russians to be absent from WEF in Davos for first time since fall of communism
217.article_body: Russian oligarchs and companies will be absent from the World Economic Forum (WEF) in Davos this year amid the invasion of Ukraine. This will mark the first time since the fall of communism that the WEF will be held without Russian officials or business leaders, Bloomberg reported. The WEF will be held in-person for the first time in two years.

218.title: Stopped 11 child marriages, caught 73 eve-teasers in 2 months: Hyd Police
218.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police said on Saturday that they had averted at least 11 child marriages and apprehended as many as 73 eve-teasers over the last eight weeks. Police further said that the eve-teasers, along with their family members, had received counselling from the authorities. Additionally, police shared a WhatsApp number for people to contact and report eve-teasing cases.

219.title: NCLAT rejects Hinduja Leyland Finance's insolvency plea against Fly Express
219.article_body: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) has dismissed the plea of Hinduja Leyland Finance Ltd to initiate insolvency proceedings against its creditor Fly Express Logistics. This comes after the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) rejected the plea in April, saying the date of default, December 24, 2022, falls within prohibition period mentioned in the Insolvency & Bankruptcy Code.

220.title: US Air Force Academy to not commission 3 cadets who refused COVID vaccine
220.article_body: Three US Air Force Academy cadets who refused the COVID-19 vaccine will graduate, but won't be commissioned, the institute's spokesperson said on Saturday. US Air Force Secretary will take the decision on whether the cadets will reimburse the educational costs in lieu of service, the spokesperson added. A fourth cadet has got vaccinated after refusing previously, the spokesperson further said.

221.title: Can't compete with giraffes around me: Aditi on her Cannes red carpet debut
221.article_body: Actress Aditi Rao Hydari recently walked the red carpet at the Cannes Film Festival 2022, which marked her first appearance at the festival. Aditi said that she's a tiny person who feels comfortable in her body and how she presents herself. "I'm a tiny person...I cannot compete with...the giraffes around me...So I've to be comfortable with who I'm," she added.

222.title: Arrest all policemen involved immediately: Activists on Hyd encounter
222.article_body: Reacting to the SC-appointed panel's findings on 2019 Hyderabad encounter, Telangana Women and Transgender Organisations Joint Action Committee (TWTOJAC) said that all policemen involved should be immediately arrested. TWTOJAC has also sought compensation for families of those killed. The panel found that police staged encounter to kill four persons accused of raping and murdering a veterinarian.

223.title: I stand corrected: Chidambaram on tweets criticising govt after fuel price cut
223.article_body: Congress' P Chidambaram has said the facts of Centre's fuel price reduction are contrary to what he had previously claimed, adding, "I stand corrected." "Entire burden of the reduction falls on the Centre," he admitted. He had earlier said the Finance Minister's exhortation to states is meaningless as 41 paise of a rupee in "central excise" belong to the states.

224.title: You don't discriminate between medallists, non-medallists: 14-yr-old shuttler to PM
224.article_body: During an interaction with PM Narendra Modi, 14-year-old shuttler Unnati Hooda told him, "What motivates me the most is that you never discriminate between medallists and non-medallists." She added, "I have learned a lot in this tournament (Uber Cup). Next time, the women's team also has to win." PM also interacted with the men's badminton team that won Thomas Cup.

225.title: Heard's 'Aquaman 2' role reduced over 'lack of chemistry': Agent
225.article_body: Amber Heard's agent Jessica Kovacevic has testified in the ongoing defamation trial against the actress, saying that her role in 'Aquaman 2' was reduced over her "lack of chemistry" with Jason Momoa. Kovacevic further stated that Heard also lost a role with Amazon due to bad press. Heard is being sued by ex-husband Johnny Depp over her 2018 op-ed article.

226.title: 4 relatives of wife including 1 minor held after man's murder in Hyd
226.article_body: A day after 20-year-old Neeraj Panwar was killed in Begum Bazar in Hyderabad, police have arrested four relatives of his wife, including one minor. The relatives were caught from Karnataka after running away from the city following the murder. Police said that the relatives were provoked by Neeraj's frequent visits to their locality after marrying against their wish.

227.title: Speeding car hits divider on Delhi flyover; woman dead, son injured
227.article_body: A 45-year-old woman died while her son was severely injured after their car rammed into a divider and crashed near a railing on the Satyawati flyover in Delhi's Ashok Vihar, police said. The incident took place early on Sunday morning. Probe is underway and CCTVs are being scanned to ascertain if another vehicle was involved in the accident, police added.

228.title: Bomb squad neutralises bombs found in WB's East Medinipur district
228.article_body: Bomb disposal squad on Sunday neutralised bombs that were recovered from West Bengal's East Medinipur district on Saturday. West Bengal Police said that huge quantity of bombs was recovered, after which, bomb disposal squad had rushed to the spot. News agency ANI had earlier reported that a combing operation was underway after the bombs were found.

229.title: 24-yr-old Delhi engineer goes missing in forest area near Pune
229.article_body: A 24-year-old engineer from Delhi who had visited Duke's Nose Point in Lonavala has been reported missing in a forest since Friday, police said. He had called his brother that he had lost track and later his mobile phone was switched off. Police said that the mechanical engineer had come to Kolhapur for some official work.

230.title: Recovered 3 candles, 4 suicide notes: Delhi Police after bodies of woman, daughters found
230.article_body: The bodies of a 54-year-old woman and her two daughters, aged 27 and 25, were found inside their flat in Delhi's Vasant Vihar. "Police found gas cylinder nozzle was partially opened. Four suicide notes were recovered and three small candles and an angithi were kept there," said DCP (Southwest) Manoj C. "It appears they died due to suffocation," he added.

231.title: Virat Kohli's old tweet thanking Rohit Sharma goes viral after MI send RCB to playoffs
231.article_body: After RCB qualified for IPL 2022 playoffs with the help of MI's victory against DC, an old tweet of Virat Kohli thanking Rohit Sharma went viral. The original tweet was posted by Kohli after Rohit had wished him on his birthday in 2019. On Saturday, Kohli also tweeted a handshake emoji, tagging Mumbai Indians.

232.title: Chulbul Pandey's wish came true: Salman on govt's police initiative
232.article_body: Actor Salman Khan on Saturday took to Twitter to commend the Central Government's new training programme to make the police force across the country more people-friendly and better the image of police personnel. "Ab Chulbul Pandey Ki Aasha Sach hui (Now Chulbul Pandey's wish has come true)," the actor wrote referencing his character from the 'Dabangg' film series.

233.title: Rahul is India's most unsuccessful, frustrated politician: MP CM
233.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday said Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is "India's most unsuccessful, frustrated and despondent politician". "No politicians make comments against the country as Rahul Gandhi does on foreign land," Chouhan said after Gandhi on Saturday said India is not in a "good place" at the 'Ideas for India' conclave in London.

234.title: TN to install cloth bag vending machines in public places, IAS officer shares video
234.article_body: Tamil Nadu government plans to install cloth bag vending machines in public places. IAS officer Supriya Sahu shared a demonstration video of the machine wherein she inserted a ₹10 coin in the machine which then dispensed a medium-sized cloth bag. It is being called a Manjapai Vending Machine as manjapai is a multipurpose bag widely used in the state.

235.title: Ricky shares video from B'luru airport at 3.30 am, says 'Pathetic state of immigration'
235.article_body: Two-time Grammy-winner Indian music composer Ricky Kej criticised the immigration process at Bengaluru International Airport. Sharing a video at 3.30 am, he tweeted, "Pathetic state of immigration...Been in line for over an hour now. Currently well over 1,000 people waiting, not all counters working, staff is clueless, inefficient. Why have so many flights, when there is no capacity? @kiranshaw."

236.title: Who is Gama Pehlwan, the undefeated wrestling champion honoured by Google?
236.article_body: Google Doodle on Sunday marked the 144th birth anniversary of Gama Pehlwan, the Amritsar-born wrestler who remained undefeated throughout his international matches and earned the name 'The Great Gama'. The wrestler saved the lives of many people during the Partition of India in 1947. Notably, Bruce Lee was a known admirer of Gama and incorporated aspects of his training routine.

237.title: Benedict to team up with Paul Greengrass for period drama 'The Hood'
237.article_body: Actor Benedict Cumberbatch and British filmmaker Paul Greengrass are teaming up for a period drama, 'The Hood'. According to reports, 'The Hood' is believed to be about a peasant uprising in England, and it will follow a farmer, played by Benedict, who becomes the rebellion's commander. Paul is known for directing films like 'The Bourne Supremacy' and '22 July'.

238.title: Punjab CM flags off cycle rally in Sangrur against drug menace
238.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Sunday flagged off a bicycle rally in Sangrur district as part of a campaign against drug menace in the state. "More than 15,000 youth joined the rally...it gives us courage. Your government will not stop till drugs are eradicated," CM Mann tweeted. The enthusiasm of the youth was evident in the bicycle rally, Mann added.

239.title: Calling any actress an item girl is unaesthetic; doesn't sound good: Helen
239.article_body: When asked about her views on item numbers, actress Helen said giving solo dances such a term is "derogatory". "I feel calling any song or actress an item number or item girl is...unaesthetic. It doesn't sound good," she added. "Everyone is a working professional...we shouldn't use the word 'item' to refer to an actress or to any song," she said.

240.title: China increases discounted Russian oil purchases by nearly 50%: Report
240.article_body: China is increasing its purchases of discounted Russian oil, as per shipping data and oil traders. While China had initially refused oil contracts with Russia due to the Ukraine war, it is projected to import 1.1 million barrels per day in May, about 47% up from 750,000 bpd in the first quarter, according to data accessed by Reuters.

241.title: We shouldn't bifurcate: Pooja Hegde on B'wood vs South debate
241.article_body: Actress Pooja Hegde, speaking about the ongoing debate on Hindi vs South film industry, said, "We all belong to...same country, it's Indian cinema." She added that people should "stop bifurcating in terms of language". "If [we] get over the subtitle part of watching a film, we'll be open to such...amazing content. It'll make us understand...genuine culture in India," said Pooja.

242.title: We'll never know if these suspects were those who raped and killed Disha: Lawyer
242.article_body: Vrinda Grover, the counsel for the petitioners who asked for a probe into Hyderabad's Disha rape and murder case, said, "We'll never know whether these four suspects were those who raped and murdered the 26-year-old in 2019." This comes after the Supreme Court-appointed panel said that the four accused were deliberately fired upon with an intent to cause their death.

243.title: Administration demolishes 5 houses after police station set on fire in Assam
243.article_body: Houses of five families who were allegedly involved in setting a police station ablaze have been demolished by the Nagaon administration. The police station was set on fire on Saturday over a man's custodial death. The deceased's family claimed that police had demanded a bribe of ₹10,000 and a duck for his release.

244.title: RR's flight faces turbulence, franchise shares video with 'Land Kara De' meme reference
244.article_body: A flight carrying Rajasthan Royals (RR) contingent to Kolkata for their Qualifier 1 match against Gujarat Titans (GT) faced turbulence due to bad weather. "What an experience this flight was, @imjitumoni almost saw god," Riyan Parag wrote on Instagram sharing a picture. RR also shared a video of their journey with 'Land Kara De' meme reference.

245.title: Police knew 2 accused were 15 before shooting them: SC panel on Hyd rape & murder case
245.article_body: The Supreme Court-appointed panel that submitted its findings into the 2019 extra-judicial killings of four people accused in the rape and murder of a Hyderabad veterinarian said that policemen knew two of them were minors. Officials reportedly visited the school of two accused and found that they were both 15 years old, a few days after the rape and murder.

246.title: Laying of stones for Ram Mandir's main structure to begin from June: Trust
246.article_body: Anil Mishra, member of the Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Teerth Kshetra Trust, said that the laying of stones for the main structure of the Ram Mandir will start from June. Reports said stone quarried in Rajasthan and Karnataka will be used to build the main structure. The stone will also be used for the sanctum sanctorum, where deity will be placed.

247.title: Faf du Plessis sent me a pic of him, Maxwell and Kohli in MI kit: David on MI-DC match
247.article_body: MI's Tim David has revealed that RCB captain Faf du Plessis sent him a message ahead of MI's IPL 2022 match against DC. "It was a picture of him, Glenn Maxwell and Virat Kohli all in MI kit. Maybe I'll have to post to Instagram later," he added. With MI's victory against DC, RCB qualified for the IPL 2022 playoffs.

248.title: PNB earns over ₹645 crore through ATM transaction charges in FY 2021-2022
248.article_body: Punjab National Bank has earned over ₹645 crore through ATM transaction charges levied on customers during the financial year 2021-22, the bank revealed while responding to an RTI. PNB also said that it collected ₹239.09 crore in the form of penalties imposed on customers who failed to maintain a minimum balance or quarterly/monthly average balance in their bank accounts.

249.title: Pune Police chief asks political outfits to hold protests peacefully
249.article_body: In an all-party meet, the Pune Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta requested the political outfits to hold protests peacefully and ensure the law and order situation doesn't get affected in Pune. Gupta also asked the parties to carry out protests at designated spots only. The meet was called in the wake of recent clashes in Pune between cadres of various outfits.

250.title: Odisha autorickshaw driver returns passenger's gold necklace worth ₹1.6 lakh
250.article_body: A 35-year-old autorickshaw driver returned a gold necklace worth ₹1.6 lakh to a female passenger, who had accidentally left it in his vehicle a few days ago, in Odisha's Ganjam. The driver found the ornament underneath the passenger seat while cleaning his autorickshaw. After misplacing the necklace, the woman called up the driver, whom she knew before.

251.title: Fire breaks out at battery cell factory in Faridabad; 3 killed
251.article_body: Three workers were killed and one had a narrow escape after a fire broke out at a battery manufacturing factory in Faridabad on Saturday. According to a senior fire officer, the building didn't have a fire no objection certificate. "Some batteries exploded and the fire quickly spread to the entire floor. The victims died from suffocation," a police officer said.

252.title: Kids at school came to sons & said 'you're lucky she's your mom': Madhuri Dixit
252.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit said children in her sons' school used to come to them saying that they are lucky to have her as their mother. "For them...it was throwing them off...some kids coming up to them and saying, 'who's your mom...we know her name...her name is Madhuri Dixit'," she said, adding, "They were like 'But you're just our mom'."

253.title: I made an effort but Kangana was rude to me at Dhaakad screening: Payal Rohatgi
253.article_body: 'Lock Upp' contestant, Payal Rohatgi, attended 'Dhaakad' screening and praised Kangana Ranaut's sister, Rangoli Chandel for being sweet. She also took a veiled dig at Kangana on Instagram and said she was "sulking". When asked if she interacted with the actress there, Payal stated, "Yes, I made an effort but she was not happy to see me and was rude."

254.title: SUV collides with truck in UP's Siddharthnagar, 7 dead
254.article_body: An SUV carrying a marriage party rammed into a stationary truck near Katya village in Uttar Pradesh's Siddharthnagar on Saturday. The SUV had 11 passengers out of which four died on the spot while three died during the treatment at the hospital, police said. The deceased were aged between 16 to 35 years, police added.

255.title: Ex govt school superintendent gets 5 yrs of jail for molesting tribal girl
255.article_body: A former superintendent of a government secondary school was sentenced to 5 years of imprisonment by a sessions court for molesting a 16-year-old tribal girl in Mumbai's Palghar region. The incident took place in December 2017, when the accused (36) allegedly called the victim, who lived in the school's hostel since childhood, into his room and molested her.

256.title: India's historic Thomas Cup-winning team interacts with PM, gifts him racquet, sweets
256.article_body: India's historic Thomas Cup-winning team members interacted with PM Narendra Modi. PM Modi's social media accounts shared a video of their interaction. In the video, Kidambi Srikanth can be seen presenting PM Modi a racquet, while Lakshya Sen was seen gifting him 'bal mithai'. "The 'Yes, we can do it' attitude has become...new strength in India today," PM Modi said.

257.title: Kanika dances to Baby Doll with Gautam at post-wedding party, video surfaces
257.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing singer Kanika Kapoor dancing to her song 'Baby Doll' with her husband Gautam Hathiramani at their post-wedding party. Kanika wore a shimmery red one-shoulder dress for the function, while Gautam was seen in a blue-coloured shirt. Kanika and Gautam tied the knot on Friday at a hotel in London.

258.title: Kartik doesn't eat & sleep during promotions: 'Bhool...' co-star Kiara
258.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani, while speaking about her 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' co-star Kartik Aaryan, said that he doesn't sleep and eat during promotions. "He is consumed by putting the film out there. His whole mind is always on release and in promotion," she added. Kiara further said she feels Kartik is a "very driven actor". The film released on May 20.

259.title: Highly unusual: WHO on monkeypox spread outside Africa with no travel links
259.article_body: After monkeypox cases were confirmed in 12 nations, the WHO has said that it was "highly unusual" to find patients with no travel links to an endemic area. Monkeypox endemic countries are: Benin, Cameroon, the Central African Republic, the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Gabon, Ghana, Ivory Coast, Liberia, Nigeria, the Republic of the Congo, Sierra Leone and South Sudan.

260.title: There's no fight for Kashi, Mathura as it's all self-evident: Uma Bharti
260.article_body: There is no fight for Kashi and Mathura because it's all "self-evident", BJP's Uma Bharti said. She was referring to some sacred symbols which were reportedly found on the outer walls of Gyanvapi Mosque. "Kashi Vishwanath is among the 12 jyotirlingas...the shivling and the temple there are very special. There is no question of a fight there," Bharti added.

261.title: Will think about where I missed out in my loyalty: Azam Khan
261.article_body: SP leader Azam Khan said he will think about where he missed out in his loyalty and became a "vessel of hatred". His statement comes after he was given interim bail. On being asked why his party didn't raise concern for him, Khan added, "I was in jail for a long time, don’t know what happened politically."

262.title: 2 students practising for rowing event die as storm hits South Kolkata
262.article_body: Two out of five school students lost their lives after the boat they were travelling in overturned when a sudden storm hit South Kolkata on Saturday. The two were out practising for a rowing event. They were rescued from the water and rushed to the hospital where they were declared dead on arrival, police said.

263.title: Group beats staffer after argument over traffic jam at pump in Pune
263.article_body: A group of men allegedly beat an employee at a CNG pump in Pune's Narhe on Saturday after an argument broke out between one of the men and the latter over traffic congestion at the pump. A video of the incident has surfaced online. Earlier, the price of CNG had been hiked to ₹80 per kilogram in the district.

264.title: PM Modi among first global leaders to meet Australia's new PM in Tokyo
264.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will be among the first global leaders to meet Australia's new PM Anthony Albanese during the Quad summit that will take place in Tokyo on May 24. Albanese is expected to hold one-to-one meetings with PM Modi, US President Joe Biden and Japanese PM Fumio Kishida. PM Modi congratulated Albanese on Saturday soon after his poll victory.

265.title: Rahul lacks consistency, needs clarity in thought process: TMC leader
265.article_body: TMC leader Sukhendu Sekhar Ray said that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi lacks consistency and should bring some clarity in his thought process. "A few days back he had said the regional parties lack ideology and only Congress can fight against the BJP. Today he is saying something completely different," Ray added. Gandhi should clarify which statement is true, he stated.

266.title: One arrested for thrashing mentally ill man to death in MP's Neemuch
266.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh Police have arrested a man for thrashing a mentally unstable man to death in Neemuch. Police said that accused, Dinesh Kushwaha, has accepted that he is the one beating the man in the video of incident that went viral earlier. In the video, the deceased was seen being slapped while being asked if his "name is Mohammed".

267.title: How have MI fared on IPL points table over the years as they record worst finish in 2022?
267.article_body: Five-time champions MI recorded their worst performance in an IPL season in 2022 after losing 10 of their 14 matches. MI finished last on the points table in 2022. Their previous worst performance had come in 2009, when they finished seventh (second-last) after losing eight matches. MI have topped the table four times in IPL history.

268.title: Nehru left us to be with Pakistan: Assam CM on Rahul Gandhi's remarks in London
268.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma has said that Assam never negotiated peace with India. He added, "With Gandhiji's support, Gopinath Bordoloi had to struggle to keep Assam with Bharat Mata since Nehru left us to be with Pakistan as per Cabinet Mission Plan." This comes after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said, "UP, Maharashtra, Assam, Tamil Nadu created a negotiated peace."

269.title: Assam prof sends emails to officials criticising state govt, CM; held
269.article_body: An associate professor of a college was arrested in Assam's Hailakandi on Saturday for allegedly sending emails criticising the state government to the Superintendent of Police and other officials in the district, a police officer said. The accused had also purportedly used unparliamentary terms against the state CM and Education Minister in the emails, a police station officer-in-charge said.

270.title: 31-yr-old man sentenced to 15 yrs jail for drugging, raping woman
270.article_body: A Mumbai special court has sentenced a 31-year-old man to 15 years of imprisonment for drugging and raping his female colleague. The accused had even allegedly recorded a video of the sexual act to extort the victim, who is married, for money amounting to ₹10,000. Notably, both of them used to work together at a hospital.

271.title: 4 dead after severe storms hit Canada; 9 lakh homes without power
271.article_body: Four people have died after severe storms hit the eastern Canadian provinces of Ontario and Quebec on Saturday, authorities said. One of the deceased was killed when a tree fell on the trailer he was staying in. According to local power suppliers Hydro One and Hydro-Quebec, nearly nine lakh homes in the two provinces were without electricity the same night.

272.title: Musk, stop horsing around & close this Twitter deal: YouTube Co-founder
272.article_body: YouTube Co-founder Chad Hurley tweeted to Tesla CEO Elon Musk, "Stop horsing around and close this Twitter deal. We all want a happy ending!" Apparently referring to the recent allegations of him offering to buy a horse for a flight attendant in exchange for an erotic massage, Musk replied, "Fine, if you touch my wiener, you can have a horse."

273.title: What is the problem, what is wrong with it: Akshay Kumar on remakes
273.article_body: Akshay Kumar in an interview said, "Someone questioned me...about remakes and why are we remaking it? I asked why not...What's the problem?" "'Oh My God!' was remade in Telugu and became a huge hit. 'Rowdy Rathore' we remade and worked for...us," he said, adding, "If a good film is being made in South and we...remake it, what's wrong in it?"

274.title: India on road to contribute 15% of world GDP by 2047: Scindia
274.article_body: India has to focus on building capability as it is on the road to providing 25% of the total global workforce and contributing 15% of global GDP by 2047, Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said. "India has shown that the Indian way of globalisation will show the path for globalisation that will be balanced...and pivoted on territorial integrity," Scindia added.

275.title: Mob sets Assam police station on fire over alleged custodial death
275.article_body: A mob allegedly vandalised and set a police station on fire in Assam's Nagaon on Saturday over a man's custodial death. The deceased's family claimed that police had demanded a ₹10,000 bribe and a duck for his release. A video of the incident has surfaced online. Nagaon SP Leena Doley said that two police officers were injured in the incident.

276.title: Johar shares throwback pic with Zoya, Anurag, Dibakar from Cannes 2013
276.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar recently took to his Instagram Stories to share a throwback picture of him, Zoya Akhtar, Anurag Kashyap and Dibakar Banerjee from the 2013 Cannes Film Festival. "Cannes throwback@ 2013! #bombaytalkies," he wrote along with the picture. Karan, Zoya, Anurag and Dibakar's 'Bombay Talkies' was screened at Cannes that year.

277.title: Aayush walks out of 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi...'; cites creative differences: Reports
277.article_body: Aayush Sharma, who was set to star in Salman Khan's 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali', reportedly walked out of the film. According to reports, he started shooting for his portions of film and even completed a day's worth of shooting. However, creative differences arose between him and the production house and he decided to walk out of the film, reports added.

278.title: She was always late to rehearsals, we fought like cats and dogs: Remo on wife
278.article_body: Choreographer-director Remo Dsouza said that he used to make his wife Lizelle Dsouza rehearse after she joined Ahmed Khan's dance group in their initial days of meeting each other. "She was always late, so we fought like cats and dogs...One day we realised that despite our fights, there is love between us," he added.

279.title: Owners to be fined ₹1,000 for non-registration of pet dogs in Mohali from June 1
279.article_body: The Mohali Municipal Corporation has decided to fine the owners for non-registration of their pet dogs in the city. The owners will be fined ₹1,000 from June 1. The corporation had initiated the process of registrations in November 2021. MC commissioner Kamal Kumar Garg said that teams have been formed to survey areas to identify unregistered dogs.

280.title: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly buys new mansion in Kolkata for over ₹40 crore
280.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly has bought a new mansion in central Kolkata for over ₹40 crore. It is a 23.6-kottah plot with a two-storey building on Lower Rawdon Street. "I am happy to have my own home. Living in the central area will be convenient. But it’s hard to leave the home where I lived for 48 years," Ganguly said.

281.title: Mayhem Studios launches the trailer of Underworld Gang Wars
281.article_body: Mayhem Studios offered a sneak peek into its upcoming Battle Royale game Underworld Gang Wars. The brand revealed that the game revolves around the arch-rivalry between two protagonists Boris & Tyagi and their respective gangs Bhokal Toli & Velvets. With locations, plots, weapons & vehicles rooted in India, UGW brings the much-loved Battle Royale format an Indian touch, it added.

282.title: Army personnel in highly-sensitive regiment honeytrapped by Pakistani agent, arrested
282.article_body: Rajasthan Police have arrested an Indian Army personnel posted in a highly-sensitive regiment for allegedly leaking information to a female agent of Pakistani intelligence agency, said Umesh Mishra, DG (Intelligence). The Indian Army personnel was identified as Pradeep Kumar. He was in constant contact with the female agent through social media and was sharing information of strategic importance.

283.title: Oil spills on road after tanker overturns in Maha; video surfaces
283.article_body: A video has surfaced showing villagers collecting oil in cans and utensils after an edible oil tanker overturned, causing the liquid to spill on the road near Maharashtra's Dahanu. The tanker was carrying around 12,000 litres of oil. The incident occurred after the driver lost control of the tanker. The driver sustained injuries and was admitted to a health centre.

284.title: Apple may expand production in India amid tight COVID-19 norms in China: Report
284.article_body: Apple has reportedly instructed several of its contract manufacturers that it is looking to expand production outside of China amid its tight COVID-19 restrictions. According to The Wall Street Journal, India and Vietnam, that account for a minority of Apple's global production, are being considered for this. It also said Apple is speaking to existing Indian suppliers regarding the expansion.

285.title: Tejasswi is delaying it; our parents meet more than us: Karan on wedding plans
285.article_body: When asked about his wedding plans with his girlfriend, actress Tejasswi Prakash, actor Karan Kundrra said that she is delaying the marriage as she's too busy. "The funny part is that our parents meet each other more than us as they have more time," he added. "But we are going with the natural progression as of now," Karan said.

286.title: Will implement Delhi model of schools in Telangana: CM KCR
286.article_body: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao (KCR) on Saturday said that his government will implement Delhi model of schools in the state. "We will soon send a team of officers from our state to coordinate," Rao added. His statement came as he, along with Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, visited a Delhi government school in the national capital on Saturday.

287.title: Several conditions imposed by police for Raj's Pune rally on Sunday
287.article_body: The Pune Police have imposed several conditions for Raj Thackeray's public rally at the Ganesh Kala Krida Manch on Sunday. Some notable conditions imposed are that the rally should be held between 10 am-2 pm, and speakers must ensure that their speech doesn't offend a particular community. Also, decibel limits of loudspeakers, as per government norms, need to be ensured.

288.title: Need help from govt: Mom of rape accused killed in 2019 Hyd encounter
288.article_body: After Supreme Court panel set up to probe killing of accused in alleged encounter after 2019 Hyderabad rape case said it does not believe police version of events, mother of one of the accused demanded help from government. She said her son won't come back and getting financial assistance from government would be of great help.

289.title: India reports 2,226 new COVID-19 cases, 65 deaths in last 24 hours
289.article_body: India has reported 2,226 COVID-19 cases, 2,202 recoveries and 65 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,323 COVID-19 cases and 25 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 14,955, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,413.

290.title: 42-yr-old Laxmi Jadhav becomes BEST buses' first-woman driver ever
290.article_body: 42-year-old Mumbai resident, Laxmi Jadhav, has become the first-woman driver ever of the city's century-old BrihanMumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) bus service. However, BEST will not be Jadhav's employer as she is an employee of a bus contractor. Jadhav, who will start working next week, will drive the bus route between the Dharavi bus depot and south Mumbai.

291.title: RCB share pics of Kohli and others dancing after MI's win against DC, post goes viral
291.article_body: RCB took to Instagram to share pictures of Virat Kohli and other players dancing after they booked a spot in IPL 2022 playoffs following MI's victory against DC. "Absolute scenes! The team had so much fun cheering for Mumbai Indians!" RCB wrote. "Emotions in the change room were unbelievable. Thank you Mumbai," Kohli said in a video shared by RCB.

292.title: How did Rohit Sharma perform in IPL 2022 as compared to other seasons?
292.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma ended his IPL 2022 campaign as statistically his worst IPL season ever. He scored 268 runs, the lowest amount of runs he has scored in any IPL season. He recorded his lowest batting average in an IPL season at 19.14. Further, this is the first time he failed to hit a fifty in an IPL season.

293.title: 1 yr of hard work & 1 Friday took it all away: Arjun on Tevar's performance
293.article_body: Arjun Kapoor, speaking about his 2015 action-drama 'Tevar', said he was "heartbroken" after the film didn't work at the box office. "It was produced by my family...I'd not signed any other film while doing [it]...because I wanted to put all my energy into it," Arjun said, adding, "So one whole year of hard work and one Friday...took it all away."

294.title: I am an electrical engineer, didn’t think of launching a makeup brand: SUGAR CEO
294.article_body: SUGAR Cosmetics CEO Vineeta Singh took to LinkedIn to share how she launched her brand while being an electrical engineer and with no experience with makeup. "I didn’t think of launching a makeup brand…Kaushik Mukherjee [her husband] and I started something else and it failed and it was our customers who literally took us down this road," she said.

295.title: India can be world's 4th largest economy by 2047: Scindia
295.article_body: India can become the world's fourth largest economy by 2047, Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said on Saturday. "By the year 2047, there will be full saturation of all the government schemes and a per capita income of ₹53,000 in 2010-11, will reach above ₹4 lakh per person by 2047," Scindia added. He was speaking at the 7th India Ideas Conclave.

296.title: Infosys reappoints Salil Parekh as MD, CEO for 5 years
296.article_body: Infosys on Sunday said that its board has reappointed Salil Parekh as Managing Director and CEO for five more years, from July 1, 2022, to March 31, 2027. Parekh has been holding both posts since 2018 and was previously a member of the Group Executive Board at Capgemini, where he held several leadership positions for 25 years.

297.title: 2 students out to get juice fall from 2nd floor of B'luru building, 1 dies
297.article_body: Two second year BCom students fell from the second floor of a shopping complex in Bengaluru. While the girl, Liya, lost her life in the incident, her male friend, Chris Peter, has sustained injuries. The two had reportedly gone to the complex to get some juice. They lost balance on the stairs and fell from the glass window.

298.title: Man kidnapped & shot dead in Pune, his body dumped at ghat
298.article_body: Two people were arrested after a 38-year-old man was allegedly kidnapped, shot dead in Pune's Warje and his body was dumped at Tamhini Ghat. The deceased had gone missing recently, following which the police caught the duo who'd been seen accompanying him. The police recovered the body after the duo's interrogation revealed that it was dumped at the ghat.

299.title: Raj govt reduces VAT on petrol by ₹2.48 per litre, diesel by ₹1.16 per litre
299.article_body: The Rajasthan government has reduced Value-added tax (VAT) on petrol by ₹2.48 per litre and diesel by ₹1.16 per litre in the state. State Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot took to Twitter to announce the decision and said that after the move, petrol will be cheaper by ₹10.48 and diesel by ₹7.16 per litre in the state.

300.title: Woman, 2 daughters found dead at home in Delhi; suicide suspected
300.article_body: A 54-year-old woman and her two daughters were found dead at their home in Delhi on Saturday, in what police believe is a triple suicide case. DCP (Southwest) Manoj C said that prima facie, it appears that the trio died due to suffocation. The woman's husband had died due to COVID-19 last year, "since then...family had been depressed", DCP added.

301.title: Wasn't sure why they picked me: Plabita on playing fetish girl in 'Lipstick...'
301.article_body: Speaking about playing the character of a fetish girl in 'Lipstick Under My Burkha', actress Plabita Borthakur said, "Even for the fetish girl role, I wasn't sure why they picked me. I wasn't sure whether I'll be able to pull it off." "It was an unconventional film, so...I'm lucky to have started with something like that," she added.

302.title: Who will play whom in IPL 2022 playoffs?
302.article_body: Gujarat Titans and Rajasthan Royals finished as top two teams on the IPL 2022 points table and will play the Qualifier 1 on Tuesday. The winner will reach the final while the loser will play the winner of Wednesday's Eliminator between Lucknow Super Giants and Royal Challengers Bangalore. The winner of the Qualifier 2 will qualify for the final.

303.title: Congress compares excise duty on petrol and diesel in May 2014 and now
303.article_body: After the Centre reduced excise duty on fuel, Congress compared the excise duty in May 2014 and now. Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala tweeted that excise duty on petrol in May 2014 was ₹9.48/litre and it is ₹19.90/litre now after Centre's duty cut. Surjewala added that excise duty on diesel was ₹3.56/litre and it is ₹15.80/litre after the tax cut.

304.title: Mom had uterus cancer, I've never seen her; spent childhood with dad: Krushna
304.article_body: In a video shared by actor Maniesh Paul, Comedian Krushna Abhishek said his mother had uterus cancer and that he has never seen her. "I've spent my childhood with my father...I recently saw my mother...in a video...My grandmother (Govinda's mother) who was a singer...was present in the video...she was singing and my mother...was sitting with her...and singing," he added.

305.title: Petrol and diesel prices reduced after remaining unchanged for 45 days
305.article_body: Prices of petrol and diesel have been reduced after remaining unchanged for 45 days. This comes after the government reduced central excise duty on petrol and diesel. Petrol price in Delhi has been reduced from ₹105.41/litre to ₹96.72/litre. Meanwhile, diesel in Delhi now costs ₹89.62/litre. Petrol in Mumbai and Kolkata now costs ₹111.35/litre and ₹106.03/litre, respectively.

306.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read as RCB qualify for playoffs?
306.article_body: MI on Saturday defeated DC by five wickets to end their campaign with four victories. With MI's victory, RCB qualified for the playoffs. RCB finished the league stage with 16 points, while DC finished the league stage with 14 points. GT topped the table with 20 points, followed by RR (18 points) and LSG (18 points). CSK finished ninth.

307.title: Ex-Pak PM praises India, says 'Despite US pressure, it bought discounted Russian oil'
307.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan praised India after the central government reduced fuel prices. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "Despite being part of the Quad, India sustained pressure from the US and bought discounted Russian oil to provide relief to the masses. This is what our government was working to achieve with the help of an independent foreign policy."

308.title: One more person involved in killing of policemen in Guna arrested
308.article_body: An official said that another person involved in the killing of three policemen in Madhya Pradesh's Guna district was arrested. With this, three accused have so far been killed and five others have been arrested in the case, the official added. Earlier this month, three policemen were killed after a group of poachers opened fire on them.

309.title: RCB qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs as MI win their last match to eliminate DC
309.article_body: Bottom-placed MI on Saturday defeated DC in their last IPL 2022 match to end their campaign with four victories. With this, DC were eliminated from the playoffs race as they finished their season with 14 points from seven victories. Meanwhile, RCB became the fourth team after GT, LSG and RR to qualify for the playoffs.

310.title: Did not discuss Cabinet expansion with BJP top brass: K'taka CM
310.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that he did not discuss the issue of Cabinet expansion with the BJP top brass during his recent visit to Delhi. "I met BJP state in-charge Arun Singh...and discussed the Legislative Council and Rajya Sabha elections," Bommai said. Earlier this month, Bommai had said that Cabinet expansion will take place shortly.

311.title: 103 fake doctors found practising illegally in Maharashtra's Jalna
311.article_body: Officials said 166 unregistered medical practitioners were found practising illegally in Maharashtra's Jalna district, out of which 103 were bogus doctors. A report from the health department said that Jalna had 433 doctors, out of which 267 were registered with the Maharashtra Medical Council. The report stated that 103 bogus doctors operated in rural areas and slums, endangering lives.

312.title: Rabri Devi slaps her supporter for heckling officers during raid at her home
312.article_body: A video showing former Bihar CM Rabri Devi slapping an RJD supporter for heckling CBI officers has gone viral online. The incident took place when CBI officers raided Rabri and Lalu Yadav's Patna residence in connection to the railway recruitment scandal. Rabri is seen telling protesters to calm down and then slapping a supporter for blocking officers' exit.

313.title: Man kills wife with an axe after an argument in Sikar, arrested
313.article_body: Police said that a man was arrested after he killed his 25-year-old wife with an axe following an argument in Rajasthan's Sikar. After committing the crime, the accused ran towards railway tracks saying he was going to kill himself, Sikar's Additional Superintendent of Police said. He added that the locals caught him and handed him over to the police.

314.title: Turkey holds talks with Sweden, Finland amid their bid to join NATO
314.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan on Saturday discussed his concerns with Swedish PM Magdalena Andersson and Finnish President Sauli Niinistö after objecting to Sweden and Finland joining NATO. Turkey has claimed that Sweden and Finland harbour people linked to a Kurdish militant group and followers of Fethullah Gulen, whom the Turkish government accuses of orchestrating a 2016 coup attempt.

315.title: Better than nothing: Pawar over excise duty cut on petrol, diesel
315.article_body: After the government reduced the excise duty on petrol and diesel, NCP chief Sharad Pawar said, "It is better than nothing." Notably, PM Narendra Modi-led government on Saturday cut excise duty on petrol and diesel by ₹8 and ₹6 per litre, respectively. This will reduce the price of petrol by ₹9.5 per litre and of diesel by ₹7 per litre.

316.title: Ex-Pak minister Mazari beaten, taken into police custody: Family
316.article_body: Pakistan's ex-federal minister Shireen Mazari was arrested in Islamabad over a decades-old land grabbing allegation, her family said. Mazari's daughter tweeted, "Male police officers have beaten and taken my mother away. All I've been told is that Anti Corruption Wing Lahore has taken her." Notably, Islamabad High Court has ordered Mazari to be produced before it at 11:30 pm tonight.

317.title: Kartik Aaryan's 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' becomes biggest Bollywood opener of 2022
317.article_body: Kartik Aaryan and Kiara Advani starrer 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' has received the biggest opening of the year for a Bollywood film, as per a tweet by Bollywood trade analyst Taran Adarsh. It has earned ₹14.11 crore on first day of its release. The film has surpassed the first day earnings of 'Bachchhan Pandey' (₹13.25 crore) and 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' (₹10.50 crore).

318.title: IFS officer Vivek Kumar appointed as Private Secretary to PM Modi
318.article_body: Indian Foreign Service (IFS) officer Vivek Kumar has been appointed as Private Secretary (PS) to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, according to a government order. Kumar is a 2004-batch IFS officer and he is currently the director of the Prime Minister's Office (PMO). He will be succeeding Sanjeev Kumar Singla, who has been appointed as India's Ambassador to Israel.

319.title: Opposition-ruled states should also reduce fuel rates: BJP's Nadda
319.article_body: After the government reduced the excise duty on petrol and diesel, BJP chief JP Nadda said that Opposition should also reduce fuel rates in the states governed by them so that the common people can get some relief amid inflation. The excise duty cut will reduce the petrol and diesel prices by ₹9.5 per litre and ₹7 per litre, respectively.

320.title: Diplomats fixed colleges for Pt Nehru's grandkids: Rijiju as Rahul criticises IFS
320.article_body: After Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the current Indian Foreign Service (IFS), Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said, "Diplomats (under Congress government) were busy fixing colleges for grandkids of (ex-PM) Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru." Rijiju shared tweets by the great-grandson of a former government official, which showed ex-Foreign Secretary TN Kaul seeking advice on colleges for Rajiv Gandhi.

321.title: Healthtech startup MFine fires about 50% of its workforce: Report
321.article_body: Bengaluru-based healthtech startup MFine has fired more than 500 employees, or about 50% of its workforce, amid a funding crunch, Moneycontrol reported. The lay offs have reportedly affected employees across data science, engineering and product departments as well as talent acquisition team. MFine told employees that it is short on funds to release salaries for coming months, Moneycontrol added.

322.title: Rohit Sharma fails to hit a fifty in an IPL season for the first time ever
322.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma was dismissed for 2(13) in his team's last IPL 2022 match against DC. With this, he failed to hit a fifty in entire IPL 2022. This is the first time ever that Rohit failed to score a half century in an IPL season. Rohit's highest score in IPL 2022 was 48(36), which came against SRH.

323.title: CBFC gives Ayushmann's 'Anek' U/A certificate, removes cuss words
323.article_body: CBFC has passed Ayushmann Khurrana-starrer 'Anek' with a U/A certificate after suggesting several additions and deletions. This includes removing multiple cuss words as well as replacing 'China' and 'Chinese' to address North-Eastern girls and a dialogue around a real-life personality. CBFC also asked for the insertion of a disclaimer stating that it doesn't promote crimes committed by children.

324.title: Look forward to strengthening our ties: PM Modi to Aus PM-elect
324.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday congratulated Anthony Albanese, who is set to be Australia's next PM, for securing a victory in the Australian national election. "I look forward to working towards further strengthening our Comprehensive Strategic Partnership, and for shared priorities in the Indo-Pacific region," he tweeted. PM Modi also congratulated Albanese for Labor Party's win in the election.

325.title: 963 Americans banned from entering Russia so far: Russian ministry
325.article_body: The Russian Foreign Ministry on Saturday said that it has banned 963 US citizens from entering Russia so far. The West and Russia began to impose travel bans on individuals since the start of war in Ukraine on February 24. The ministry also said that it would continue to retaliate against what it called hostile US actions.

326.title: Madonna blocked from Instagram Live after posting nude pictures
326.article_body: Singer Madonna shared a series of videos on Instagram Stories claiming that she has been blocked from going Live on the social media platform. One of the videos shows a message from Instagram reading she has been temporarily banned for going Live. The 63-year-old had earlier shared NFTs which included a 3D animation of things coming out of her vagina.

327.title: Surprised they want to remake 'Anand': Director's granddaughter
327.article_body: Tapur Chatterji, the granddaughter of late director Hrishikesh Mukherjee, said that she was surprised to hear about his 1971 film 'Anand' being remade. Tapur further said, "It's nice to know that classics like these are still remembered and are being remade for the new generation...I hope they do justice to it." The film had starred Rajesh Khanna and Amitabh Bachchan.

328.title: Why is PM Modi reluctant to condemn riots?: Rajasthan CM
328.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot questioned why PM Narendra Modi was "reluctant" to condemn 'riots' taking place in various parts of the country, adding that the PM must condemn anti-social elements. Addressing the media on Rajiv Gandhi's death anniversary, Gehlot said, "Current government is vehement in forgetting the legacy of previous governments and former Prime Ministers."

329.title: Doja Cat says she needs tonsil surgery, will quit vaping for a while
329.article_body: American rapper Doja Cat has revealed that she needs to undergo tonsil surgery and will quit vaping "for a while". "[I'm] too scared to hit it [because] my throat hurts so bad. I cried for hours. [It's] not worth it," she tweeted. The rapper has also cancelled her performance at The Weeknd's stadium tour as well as upcoming festival dates.

330.title: Bengal BJP leaders only interested in social media politics: BJP MP
330.article_body: BJP MP Arjun Singh said that he has informed BJP National President JP Nadda that West Bengal BJP leaders are only 'interested in social media politics and not doing ground-level work'. "Delhi is looking into the matter at its own level," he said. Singh added that BJP should give responsibility to those who are capable and deserve it.

331.title: Kerala govt to cut state tax on petrol by ₹2.41 per litre, diesel by ₹1.36 per litre
331.article_body: Kerala government on Saturday announced that it will reduce state tax on the price of petrol by ₹2.41 per litre and that of diesel by ₹1.36 per litre. Earlier, the central government said it will cut excise duty on petrol and diesel by ₹8 and ₹6 per litre, respectively, to provide relief to the common man amid rising prices.

332.title: Very suspicious: Musk as Twitter refuses to explain calculation of fake accounts
332.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk said it is "very suspicious" that Twitter is refusing to explain how it calculates that 5% of its daily users are fake or spam. He also agreed with a Twitter user who said that if 25% of Twitter users are bots, then the acquisition deal, which was priced at $44 billion, should cost 25% less.

333.title: India supplies another 40,000 metric tonnes of diesel to Sri Lanka
333.article_body: India on Saturday supplied another 40,000 metric tonnes of diesel to Sri Lanka amid an economic crisis in the country. Last month, India extended an additional $500 million credit line to help Sri Lanka import fuel. Separately, India's High Commission on Friday said that a ship carrying rice, milk powder and medicines from India will reach Sri Lanka on Sunday.

334.title: T'gana CM meets Kejriwal; praises Delhi's mohalla clinics, govt schools
334.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Saturday met Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and visited Delhi government schools and mohalla clinics. Later while speaking to reporters, the Telangana CM said that the Delhi government's efforts in the field of education are commendable. "[Delhi government] sent their teachers abroad for training, now we'll send our teachers...[to Delhi] to get oriented," he added.

335.title: Felt good to hear those words: Kiccha Sudeep on PM's remark on Indian languages
335.article_body: Kannada actor Kiccha Sudeep said he had no intention to spark a debate with his comments on Hindi as he praised PM Narendra Modi for calling Indian languages soul of 'Bharatiyata'. "It felt good to hear...those words," he added. Sudeep was recently involved in a Twitter exchange with Ajay Devgn over his 'Hindi is no more our national language' remark.

336.title: Can't carry sad face everywhere: Akshay on Bachchhan Paandey flopping
336.article_body: On being asked about 'Bachchhan Paandey' failing at the box office, Akshay Kumar said that you "can't carry around your sad face everywhere". He further said you can feel bad from Friday to Sunday, but you have to pick yourself up and go do another film on Monday. "Good films are only made because you enjoy the film," Akshay added.

337.title: Prez Biden signs $40 billion aid bill for Ukraine's war effort
337.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Saturday signed a bill to provide nearly $40 billion in aid for Ukraine in its fight against Russia, the White House announced. The legislation includes $20 billion in military assistance and $8 billion in general economic support. Notably, Biden signed the bill while visiting South Korea on his first trip to Asia as the President.

338.title: Sidhu hasn't eaten in nearly 24 hours in jail due to wheat allergy: Lawyer
338.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu, who surrendered and was taken to Patiala Jail on Friday, hasn't eaten anything since then, his lawyer HPS Verma said today. The 58-year-old has been refusing prison food as he's allergic to wheat, Verma said. He added that a court appeal has been made to make food available to Sidhu as per his dietary constraints.

339.title: Thieves perform puja before stealing gold & cash worth ₹34 lakh from finance firm in Kerala
339.article_body: Thieves performed prayer rituals before looting a private finance firm of cash and gold with a total value of ₹34 lakh in Kerala, reports have said. The puja was performed near the locker from which the cash and valuables were stolen. A note reading "I am dangerous, don't follow me" was also found at the site of the burglary.

340.title: Rahul left many issues unresolved at 'chintan shivir': Shiv Sena
340.article_body: An editorial published in the Shiv Sena mouthpiece 'Saamana' said that Congress' present condition is "miserable", which is not good for the country's democracy. It said that Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has left several issues unresolved at the party's recently concluded 'chintan shivir'. "This is why several leaders in different states are deserting the party," it added.

341.title: What he said is true: Raut on Rahul's 'kerosene' remark against BJP
341.article_body: After Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that the BJP has spread kerosene all over the country and only one spark could create a big trouble, Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said, "What he said is true". Raut said, "We have said the same thing in different words. It's like strangulating the country's democracy with the help of central probe agencies."

342.title: Australian PM Morrison concedes defeat in general election, Anthony Albanese to take over
342.article_body: Australian Opposition leader Anthony Albanese is set to become the country's Prime Minister as Scott Morrison admitted defeat in national elections on Saturday. "I've always believed in Australians and their judgment, and I've always been prepared to accept their verdict," said Morrison. Morrison also said he would stand down as leader of the Liberal party.

343.title: It's always people first for us: PM Modi as govt cuts excise duty on petrol, diesel
343.article_body: PM Narendra Modi tweeted "it's always people first for us" after the government announced measures to help the common man, including reduced excise duty on petrol and diesel. PM said, "Today's decisions...will positively impact various sectors, provide relief to our citizens and further 'Ease of Living'." Petrol and diesel prices will be cut by ₹9.5 and ₹7 per litre, respectively.

344.title: Helly shares pics with Aishwarya at Cannes, calls it 'fan girl moment'
344.article_body:
Television actress Helly Shah, who made her debut on the red carpet at the 2022 Cannes Film Festival, met actress Aishwarya Bachchan at the festival on Friday. Helly shared a series of pictures with the actress and her daughter Aaradhya on social media, writing, "Had a fan girl moment at 
Cannes. Got to meet the [evergreen] beauty Aishwarya Rai Bachchan."

345.title: Assam-Arunachal border dispute likely to be resolved by 2023: Shah
345.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said that the boundary dispute between Arunachal Pradesh and Assam is likely to be resolved by next year. The governments of the two states are working for an amicable and permanent resolution of the dispute, he added. Separately, Shah claimed that 9,000 militants from the region have surrendered during the last eight years.

346.title: It was last minute but a great honour: Tamannaah on being at Cannes
346.article_body: Actress Tamannaah Bhatia, speaking about representing India at the 2022 Cannes Film Festival, said that the opportunity was "very last minute" but it is a great honour. She added, "Mostly I'm not prepared for things that come my way but they're all so amazing." The actress further stated that she finally feels represented "properly and truly" as an Indian actor.

347.title: What announcements has the govt made amid inflation?
347.article_body: Amid inflation, government announced measures to help relieve the common man. "This year, we'll give subsidy of ₹200 per gas cylinder (upto 12 cylinders) to over 9 crore beneficiaries of Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana," said government. "We're reducing customs duty on raw materials and intermediaries for plastic products...Import duty on some raw materials of steel will be reduced," it added.

348.title: Rainfall predicted in several states during next 5 days, IMD releases list
348.article_body: IMD has predicted rainfall in J&K, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Punjab, Haryana, UP and Rajasthan from May 21-24. Light/moderate rainfall is predicted in Bihar, Jharkhand, West Bengal, Odisha, Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh and Telangana from May 21-25 and in Karnataka on May 21 and 22. The eight northeastern states will also likely see rainfall during the next two days.

349.title: US lawmaker Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez announces her engagement
349.article_body: US Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez has confirmed that she is engaged to her longtime partner Riley Roberts. "We got engaged last month in my family's hometown in Puerto Rico...No future details yet, we're taking some space to savour this time before diving into planning," she said. The pair had met when they were undergraduate students at Boston University.

350.title: MI to bowl first against DC in their last IPL 2022 match, Prithvi Shaw returns for DC
350.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against DC in their last IPL 2022 match. MI have made two changes to their playing XI, with Dewald Brevis and Hrithik Shokeen replacing Tristan Stubbs and Sanjay Yadav, respectively. Meanwhile, Prithvi Shaw has returned to DC's playing XI, replacing Lalit Yadav.

351.title: Stock market turmoil, crypto craze a reminder of human fear and greed: CEA
351.article_body: India's Chief Economic Advisor (CEA) V Anantha Nageswaran said that the recent turmoil and volatility in the stock market and the craze with which people are investing in crypto assets is a "reminder that humans are still driven by fear and greed".
