He added, "Sometimes technology accentuates [fear and greed], rather than eliminating them."

352.title: Navi Mumbai civic body conducts cancer awareness campaign
352.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMCC) conducted a door-to-door cancer awareness campaign by circulating brochures to educate people about cancer prevention and care. "Cancer is one of the most serious concerns in the country and it becomes mandatory to reach out to people and spread awareness", an official said. The brochures contained information about endometrial, mouth and breast cancer.

353.title: Live organs transported in 27 mins via green corridor in Hyderabad
353.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police in coordination with the Cyberabad Traffic Police provided a green corridor for an ambulance carrying live organs. A pair of lungs was transported over a distance of 36.8 km in 27 minutes. The organs were transported from Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in Shamshabad and KIMS Hospital in Hyderabad.

354.title: GHMC working on permanent solution to prevent floods in Hyd: Mayor
354.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) is working on a permanent solution to prevent flooding, GHMC Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal said. She added that phase 1 of Strategic Nala Development Programme (SNDP) is in progress and efforts are underway to complete it before monsoon. A GHMC press release said that 83 projects have been sanctioned at the cost of ₹954 crore.

355.title: Govt to cut central excise duty on petrol by ₹8 per litre, diesel by ₹6 per litre
355.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced the government will reduce central excise duty on petrol and diesel by ₹8 and ₹6 per litre, respectively. She said, "This will reduce the price of petrol by ₹9.5 per litre and of diesel by ₹7 per litre." She also announced a subsidy of ₹200 per gas cylinder to beneficiaries of Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana.

356.title: Thinking of stopping organ transplant procedures: Ruby Hall Clinic
356.article_body: In the wake of alleged malpractice in a kidney transplant procedure at the hospital, Pune-based Ruby Hall Clinic's CEO Bomi Bhote said, "We're considering...to stop all organ transplants." Bhote said that after conducting over 1,800 kidney transplants, the "entire effort seems futile when attempts are being made to defame the institution". The clinic's doctors have been booked in the case.

357.title: Zilingo wrongfully fired me, didn't give a chance to address concerns: Ankiti Bose
357.article_body: Singapore-based Zilingo's Indian-origin Co-founder Ankiti Bose has claimed that the company's board "wrongfully terminated" her as CEO for "insubordination". Zilingo said it had fired Bose after an investigation into complaints of "serious financial irregularities". Bose said in a statement to Reuters that the board did not give her a "chance to address fully the concerns that have been raised".

358.title: Minister invites Edinburgh University to open its campus in B'luru
358.article_body: Karnataka Higher Education Minister CN Ashwathnarayan on Friday visited the UK's Edinburgh University and held discussions with its top officials. The minister invited them to set up a university's campus in Bengaluru to collaborate with educational institutions for learning and adopting innovative methods. The university's officials have responded positively to his proposal, his office said.

359.title: Telangana CM KCR meets SP chief Akhilesh Yadav in New Delhi
359.article_body: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao met Samajwadi Party President Akhilesh Yadav at the former's official residence on the Tughlaq Road in New Delhi. "The two leaders discussed current national issues," an official statement said. Notably, Rao is in Delhi as part of his week-long tour to attend national-level political and social programmes, according to a report.

360.title: Hyderabad Police seize 500 bottles of hash oil, 7 arrested
360.article_body: The Hyderabad Police busted an interstate drug peddling gang and arrested four drug peddlers and three consumers. Police recovered 500 bottles of hash oil, one car and six mobile phones, worth ₹10 lakh altogether. Police said that each bottle contained 5 ml of hash oil. The accused were selling each bottle to consumers for ₹2,000-₹2,500, they added.

361.title: 2 try to extort ₹10 lakh from Mumbai man by accusing him of rape, held
361.article_body: Police said they arrested two men for assaulting and trying to extort ₹10 lakh from a Mumbai-based businessman with the help of their female accomplice. The businessman in his statement said that the woman came close to him and when he tried to stop her, the two men accused him of raping her. They later demanded ₹10 lakh from him.

362.title: Siddhant Chaturvedi gives surprise performance at Divine's concert
362.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi on Friday made a surprise appearance at rapper Divine's concert in Mumbai and performed as his 'Gully Boy' character MC Sher. The 2019 film was based on the lives of Indian rappers Divine and Naezy. Siddhant also took to social media to share pictures of his appearance, writing that Divine invited him and he didn't think twice.

363.title: Only 35% nullah cleaning work completed in Mumbai: BJP
363.article_body: BJP MLA Ashish Shelar criticised Mumbai's civic body BMC and claimed that only 35% of nullah cleaning work has been completed in the city. "The Shiv Sena-led BMC needs to explain why 65% of nullah cleaning work has remained incomplete. Who is responsible?" Shelar questioned. Shelar's statements came after he inspected the progress of nullah cleaning work on Thursday.

364.title: Boy rapes 13-yr-old girl in Gurugram while his friend stands guard
364.article_body: Police have arrested a 17-year-old boy for allegedly raping a 13-year-old girl in Gurugram. The sister of the victim has alleged that the accused had barged into her sister's room when she was sleeping and raped her, while his 15-year-old friend locked the room from outside and stood guard. The accused's friend has also been arrested by the police.

365.title: No one can say a virus will become pandemic, no need to panic: Doctor on monkeypox cases
365.article_body: Amid detection of monkeypox cases in some foreign countries, a health expert insisted on observing its evolution while also advising not to panic. "No one can say for a fact that a virus will become a pandemic," said Dr Ishwar Gilada. "Monkeypox is zoonotic like HIV that initially came as monkey virus called simian immunodeficiency virus," he added.

366.title: 113 flyers made to wait at B'luru airport as gate key goes missing
366.article_body: About 113 passengers arriving at Bengaluru airport were reportedly made to wait for over 20 minutes at an arrival gate leading to the terminal after a security personnel was unable to unlock the gate, a report said. Meanwhile, journalist Vir Sanghvi, who tweeted about the incident, claimed the delay was caused because the key of the arrival gate went missing.

367.title: RCB change profile picture on social media in support of MI
367.article_body: RCB on Saturday changed their profile picture on their social media channels in support of MI ahead of their match against DC. RCB need MI to win to qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs. "#RedTurnsBlue for today! We're backing you to #PlayBold all the way. Go get 'em, champs!" RCB tweeted. RCB will be knocked out if DC beat MI.

368.title: Air India bans smoking, consumption of intoxicating substances at workplace
368.article_body: Tata Group-run Air India has banned smoking and consumption of intoxicating substances at the workplace. In a letter to staff, Air India's CHRO Suresh Dutt Tripathi wrote that Air India is a responsible organisation which aims to provide a safe and healthy work environment. "We have zero-tolerance for violations...Any violation...will be dealt with appropriate consequences," Tripathi further said.

369.title: DU professor Ratan Lal who was arrested for post on Gyanvapi Mosque, gets bail
369.article_body: A Delhi court has granted bail to Delhi University professor Ratan Lal who was arrested on Friday over a social media post on the alleged discovery of Shivling inside the Gyanvapi Mosque. "The feeling of hurt felt by an individual cannot represent an entire group or community," said the court. Lal got bail on furnishing of ₹50,000 bond and surety.

370.title: 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' has ended Bollywood's dry spell: Kangana
370.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut on Saturday took to Instagram Stories to write, "Congratulations to 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' for ending the dry spell at Hindi box office. Congratulations to [the] entire team of the film." Trade analyst Taran Adarsh has stated that the film is actor Kartik Aaryan's biggest opener at the box office with a business of ₹14.11 crore in India.

371.title: Magazine once asked me to have 'affair' they could 'expose': Himanshu
371.article_body: Actor Himanshu Malik, known for his role in 2001 film 'Tum Bin', has revealed that he once got a call from a magazine publication asking him to have "an affair with an upcoming actress". Himanshu added that they even offered to book a hotel room in Goa. "I was told, 'You just go there and we will expose'," he said.

372.title: Any meeting with Kim Jong-un would depend on sincerity, says Biden
372.article_body: Speaking on a potential meeting with North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, US President Joe Biden has said, "It would depend on whether he was sincere and whether he was serious." Biden made the comment during his visit to South Korea. Notably, Biden's predecessor Donald Trump had met Kim three times, before diplomatic talks between the two countries ended in 2019.

373.title: Cricketer Deepak Chahar's sister Malti to make debut with 'Ishq Pashmina'
373.article_body: Cricketer Deepak Chahar's sister Malti Chahar is set to make her Bollywood debut with 'Ishq Pashmina'. Malti will be seen opposite influencer and actor Bhavin Bhanushali. "My character in this film is very unique and I hope the audience shower the film with...love," Malti said. Directed by Arvind Pandey, 'Ishq Pashmina' also stars Zarina Wahab and Brijendra Kala.

374.title: 6 bodies recovered from tunnel collapse site in J&K, 4 still missing
374.article_body: Six bodies have been recovered so far from the debris of an under-construction tunnel that collapsed on the Jammu-Srinagar National Highway in the Ramban district on Thursday. Ramban Deputy Commissioner Mussarat Islam has said that three bodies have been identified and all were from West Bengal. The operation to locate at least four others is continuing.

375.title: Regret not taking care of myself: Arjun on his physical transformation
375.article_body: Arjun Kapoor, while talking about his recent physical transformation, said his extra work took a toll on him "mentally, emotionally and physically" and he regrets not taking care of himself. "I had implemented a very good lifestyle when I...started as an actor, somewhere that went away," he said, adding that it was COVID that gave him a reality check.

376.title: My coldest shoot ever: Parineeti on shooting at minus 12 degrees
376.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra is currently shooting for her upcoming project with singer-actor Harrdy Sandhu at a high altitude location. The actress took to Instagram on Friday to share the struggles of shooting at minus 12 degrees. "My coldest shoot ever. The best part was my hero also had to wear a thin costume and feel cold," Parineeti captioned the video.

377.title: Bihar's most-wanted gangster Azad Ali arrested in Delhi
377.article_body: Bihar's most-wanted gangster Azad Ali was arrested in Delhi by a special cell of Delhi Police on Saturday. The 43-year-old accused was held near Ring Road at Rajghat with the help of a tip-off. Ali was wanted in a shootout case during the Bihar's Vidhan Parishad election and a single-shot pistol was recovered from him, police said.

378.title: Prithviraj Chauhan was a Gurjar king, not Rajput: Gurjar body
378.article_body: Akhil Bharatiya Veer Gurjar Mahasabha has claimed that Prithviraj Chauhan was a Gurjar ruler and not a Rajput ruler. The body has also demanded that the producers of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Prithviraj' portray him as a Gurjar ruler in the film. The body's state president Manish Bhargad has asserted that the producers assured them nothing against the community will be portrayed.

379.title: GMDA lays 22-km long pipelines to use wastewater for public parks
379.article_body: The Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority has laid out 22 km of lateral pipelines along roads in order to maximise the use of treated wastewater for watering Gurugram's green belts and parks. The GMDA has planned to install 100 km of lateral pipelines in 2022-23, an official said. The major spots include Huda City Centre, Bakhtawar Chowk and IFFCO Chowk.

380.title: Bad decision, there's a clear deflection: Sachin on Wade's dismissal vs RCB
380.article_body: Reacting to GT's Matthew Wade's dismissal against RCB following a review for LBW, Sachin Tendulkar said, "[It was] unfortunate. He received a bad decision." "There was a clear deflection," added Sachin. Wade was seen throwing his bat and helmet in the dressing room after his dismissal resulting in him being reprimanded for breaching the IPL Code of Conduct.

381.title: Don't think myself as favourite for this year's French Open: Nadal
381.article_body: Twenty one-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal has said that he doesn't think of himself as a "favourite" for the upcoming French Open tournament despite winning the competition for the most number of times in history. "Unfortunately...I didn't have the preparation that I would like, and unfortunately, that rib fracture stopped a little bit (of momentum)," the 35-year-old said.

382.title: Playing for next 3 yrs at least: Shikhar Dhawan
382.article_body: After not getting picked in the Indian squad for the last year's T20 World Cup, 36-year-old batter Shikhar Dhawan has said that he is going to continue playing for "next three years at least". "I can contribute in the shortest format because of my experience...I have managed to stay consistent in the formats that I am playing," Dhawan said.

383.title: 12-year-old rape survivor gives birth in Tamil Nadu; neighbour arrested
383.article_body: A 22-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping and impregnating his 12-year-old neighbour in Tamil Nadu's Tirupathur. The girl was admitted to hospital for stomach ache last month, where doctors found she was pregnant. On being questioned, she told her mother that the accused raped her repeatedly when she was alone at home. She delivered a baby on May 3.

384.title: Telecom regulator planning KYC-based caller's identification system
384.article_body: The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) is planning to develop a KYC-based system that can help people identify a caller’s identity on a mobile phone, as per an official. Referring to it, Truecaller said, "Number identification is crucial to ending the menace of spam...calls...We appreciate this move...and would like to reiterate that we remain very supportive of this."

385.title: Rahul calls Indian Foreign Service 'arrogant', 'it's confidence', says Jaishankar
385.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has responded to Rahul Gandhi's remarks calling Indian Foreign Service officers "arrogant". "Yes, the Indian Foreign Service has changed. Yes, they follow the orders of the Government. Yes, they counter the arguments of others. No, it's not called Arrogance. It is called Confidence," said Jaishankar. Rahul made the remarks at Cambridge University in London.

386.title: Kolkata man hired women to honey trap & blackmail men; arrested
386.article_body: Kolkata Police arrested a man from Hare Street for allegedly setting up honey traps for men and blackmailing them for money. According to police, the accused would hire women who engaged in conversations with various men. They recorded video calls with them while posing nude. The accused used these videos to blackmail men and demanded money from them, police said.

387.title: Pune civic body seals 221 kiosks over non-payment of license fee
387.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has sealed 221 kiosks in Tulsibaug over non-payment of license fees. The PMC has said that it's owed ₹3 crore by kiosk owners as per the revised rates approved by the general body in 2018. "We had been sending notices since 2018 demanding dues to be paid but to no avail," a senior official said.

388.title: India's AstroSat witnesses black hole birth for 500th time in space
388.article_body: AstroSat, India's dedicated astronomy mission, has detected the birth of a black hole for the 500th time, Pune-based research institution IUCAA has said. It added that India is making great headway in studying the birth of these black holes. A black hole is a place in space where gravity is so strong that even light cannot escape its pull.

389.title: Was taken aback by her preparation: Akshay on 'Prithviraj' co-star Manushi
389.article_body: Akshay Kumar, while talking about his 'Prithviraj' co-star Manushi Chhillar, said he was taken aback by the actress' preparation for her role. Akshay added, "She knew she had a responsibility towards the character and she has essayed Sanyogita beautifully." "She learnt in her first film what I learnt...by my 25th film," he said while calling Manushi a natural actor.

390.title: Umpire guards MS Dhoni as fan invades ground to meet him, video goes viral
390.article_body: A video has gone viral showing a fan invading the ground to meet CSK captain MS Dhoni during CSK's match against RR on Friday. In the video, the umpire can be seen guarding MS Dhoni from a distance as the fan tried to approach the cricketer. The incident happened when Dhoni was standing near the non-striker's end while batting.

391.title: 4, including ex-BJP MP's nephew, killed in road accident in Chhattisgarh
391.article_body: At least four persons were killed after a truck rammed into a mini goods vehicle in which they were travelling on Friday in Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur, police said. One of the deceased was the nephew of former BJP MP from Bilaspur, Lakhan Lal Sahu, police added. Three of the victims died on the spot, another died in a hospital, police stated.

392.title: US, other APEC delegates walk out on Russian speaker
392.article_body: Representatives from the US and four other countries on Saturday staged a walkout when a Russian representative began his opening remarks at a meeting of trade ministers of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation group in Bangkok, officials said. The walkout was "an expression of disapproval at Russia's illegal war...in Ukraine and its economic impact in the APEC region", a diplomat said.

393.title: Feel like a racehorse scratching its stall and wanting to race: Federer
393.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer said he feels like a racehorse scratching its stall and wanting to race. "I'm ready to give it my all again," added Federer. "I am looking forward to coming home in the evening after the tough day of training and being completely exhausted," he stated. Federer has been out of action since July 2021.

394.title: Ford's internet-linked cars face nationwide sales ban in Germany
394.article_body: A German court has put a nationwide sales and production ban on Ford cars that are able to establish an internet connection, in a case over violation of wireless technology patents. The verdict is not legally binding and can still be appealed. The plaintiff, Japan's IP Bridge, needs to make a $240-million security payment for it to become "provisionally enforceable".

395.title: Doctors are being made scapegoats: ISOT on Ruby Hall Clinic case
395.article_body: The Indian Society of Nephrology (ISN) and the Indian Society of Organ Transplantation (ISOT) have condemned the handling of the case related to alleged malpractices in a kidney transplant procedure at Pune's Ruby Hall Clinic. "Doctors are being made scapegoats," Sunil Shroff, ISOT's President said. Police have booked 15 people, including some doctors of Ruby Hall Clinic, in the case.

396.title: 65-year-old man killed by tiger in Maharashtra's Chandrapur
396.article_body: A 65-year-old man was killed by a tiger in a forest area near Chandrapur, Maharashtra. The incident happened after the deceased, identified as Dashrath Pendor, had gone into the forests to graze goats on Friday, an official said. A big cat, identified as Waghadoh, is roaming in the area and the forest department is yet to catch it, official said.

397.title: Hoping to bag 4 titles by season end: Liverpool's Mo Salah
397.article_body: After already bagging the FA Cup and League Cup, Liverpool's Mohamed Salah is hoping that the club can make a quadruple by winning this year's Champions League final and the Premier League title. "I wish Manchester City lose or draw, and we win the Premier League," Salah said. "I am very excited about the (Champions League) final," he added.

398.title: Moselle Open 2010 win much better than beating Nadal or Federer: Simon
398.article_body: Former world number six Gilles Simon said winning the Moselle Open in 2010 was "much better" than defeating Rafael Nadal or Roger Federer, having beaten them in 2008. "We are talking about tennis performance," added Simon. Discussing his decision to retire from tennis at the end of the 2022 season, he stated that everything seems too difficult.

399.title: K'taka minister invites UK university to set up campus in B'luru
399.article_body: Karnataka Higher Education Minister Dr CN Ashwathnarayan on Friday invited officials from the UK's Edinburgh University to open its campus in Bengaluru, the minister's office said in a statement. He had done so during his visit to the over 400-year-old university. "Edinburgh University is renowned for multi-disciplinary education which is also the core of the National Education Policy," he said.

400.title: Will follow court's order: Rajasthan Min on rape case against son
400.article_body: Speaking on accusation against son for raping 23-year-old woman, Rajasthan Minister Mahesh Joshi said that the case is sub judice and they will follow court's orders. "Police are doing their job and so is the law. Law is same for everyone," he said. On May 8, Delhi Police filed a rape case against his son, Rohit, on the woman's complaint.

401.title: Offered COVID-19 vaccines to North Korea, got no response: US
401.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Saturday said America had offered North Korea and China COVID-19 vaccines but "got no response". North Korea, which reported its first outbreak of COVID-19 earlier this month, has recorded nearly 25 lakh "fever" cases and 66 deaths despite a "maximum emergency" epidemic campaign. North Korea is yet to start a mass vaccination campaign against COVID-19.

402.title: Cryptos are worth nothing, based on nothing: European Central Bank chief
402.article_body: European Central Bank's President Christine Lagarde said, "My very humble assessment is that it (cryptocurrency) is worth nothing, it is based on nothing, there is no underlying asset to act as an anchor of safety." Stating that she's concerned about people who have no understanding of the risks related to cryptocurrencies, Lagarde said that cryptocurrencies should be regulated.

403.title: Mentally ill man slapped, asked 'Is your name Mohammed?'; later found dead in MP
403.article_body: A missing mentally ill man named Bhanwarlal Jain was found dead in Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch and a video showing a man asking him if his "name is Mohammed", and repeatedly slapping him has surfaced on social media. The attacker in the video has been identified as Dinesh Kushwaha, who is reportedly the husband of a former BJP corporator.

404.title: Investor's defamation case against Musk, his fan & Tesla dismissed
404.article_body: A defamation and securities fraud lawsuit against Tesla, CEO Elon Musk and a Musk fan, brought forward by a Tesla investor Aaron Greenspan, has been dismissed. A US judge found that the lawsuit had failed to make plausible legal claims. The lawsuit alleged that Omar Qazi, a Musk fan, defamed Greenspan in his tweets that made baseless accusations against him.

405.title: Female dancer, others shoot dance video at Pune's Lal Mahal; booked
405.article_body: Female Marathi dancer Vaishnavi Patil and a few others have been booked for shooting a Lavani dance video at Pune's Lal Mahal, where Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj spent several years of his childhood, an official said on Saturday. According to officials, the accused hadn't taken permission for shooting the video. Meanwhile, Patil issued an apology after political leaders condemned the video.
